analyzed: upopaveṣṭum bhuvi yatra vālī  tatas nipatitām tārām cyutām tārām iva ambarāt
translated: where Vali was lying on the ground.🔽Then Hanumat, the leader of the monkeys, gently comforted Tara,

original: śanair āśvāsayām āsa hanūmān hariyūthapaḥ🔽guṇadoṣakṛtaṃ jantuḥ svakarmaphalahetukam
analyzed: śanais āśvāsayām āsa hanūmān hari yūthapaḥ  guṇa doṣa kṛtam jantuḥ sva karma phala hetukam
translated: who had fallen down like a star fallen from the sky,🔽saying, The living being obtains all, good and bad, in the next world, caused by his own actions, whether good or bad,

original: avyagras tad avāpnoti sarvaṃ pretya śubhāśubham
analyzed: avyagraḥ tat avāpnoti sarvam pretya śubha aśubham
translated: without agitation.

original: śocyā śocasi kaṃ śocyaṃ dīnaṃ dīnānukampase
analyzed: śocyā śocasi kam śocyam dīnam dīnā anukampase
translated: You grieve for the grieveable; you pity the miserable, the miserable one.

original: kaś ca kasyānuśocyo 'sti dehe 'smin budbudopame
analyzed: kaḥ ca kasya anuśocyaḥ sti dehe smin budbuda upame
translated: Who is to be grieved for by whom in this body, which is like a bubble?

original: aṅgadas tu kumāro 'yaṃ draṣṭavyo jīvaputrayā
analyzed: aṅgadaḥ tu kumāraḥ yam draṣṭavyaḥ jīva putrayā
translated: But this young Angada should be seen by you as having a living son.

original: āyatyā ca vidheyāni samarthāny asya cintaya
analyzed: āyatyā ca vidheyāni samarthāni asya cintaya
translated: And think of his future capabilities and the means to be employed.

original: jānāsy aniyatām evaṃ bhūtānām āgatiṃ gatim
analyzed: jānāsi aniyatām evam bhūtānām āgatim gatim
translated: You know that the coming and going of beings is uncertain in this way.

original: tasmāc chubhaṃ hi kartavyaṃ paṇḍite naihalaukikam
analyzed: tasmāt śubham hi kartavyam paṇḍite na aihalaukikam
translated: Therefore, good should be done by the wise in this world.

original: yasmin harisahasrāṇi prayutāny arbudāni ca
analyzed: yasmin hari sahasrāṇi prayutāni arbudāni ca
translated: In which thousands, millions, and billions of monkeys,

original: vartayanti kṛtāṃśāni so 'yaṃ diṣṭāntam āgataḥ
analyzed: vartayanti kṛta aṃśāni saḥ yam diṣṭāntam āgataḥ
translated: He has now reached the end of his destiny.

original: yad ayaṃ nyāyadṛṣṭārthaḥ sāmadānakṣamāparaḥ
analyzed: yat ayam nyāya dṛṣṭārthaḥ sāma dāna kṣamā paraḥ
translated: He who was righteous, far-sighted, and skilled in conciliation, gifts, and punishment,

original: gato dharmajitāṃ bhūmiṃ nainaṃ śocitum arhasi🔽sarve ca hariśārdūla putraś cāyaṃ tavāṅgadaḥ
analyzed: gataḥ dharma jitām bhūmim na enam śocitum arhasi  sarve ca hari śārdūla putraḥ ca ayam tava aṅgadaḥ
translated: Has gone to the land conquered by Dharma. You should not grieve for him.🔽O tiger among monkeys, and this your son Angada,

original: haryṛṣkapatirājyaṃ ca tvatsanātham anindite
analyzed: hari ṛṣka pati rājyam ca tvad sanātham anindite
translated: And the kingdom of the lord of monkeys, protected by you, O faultless one,

original: tāv imau śokasaṃtaptau śanaiḥ preraya bhāmini
analyzed: tau imau śoka saṃtaptau śanais preraya bhāmini
translated: Gently urge these two, who are tormented by grief, O beautiful one.

original: tvayā parigṛhīto 'yam aṅgadaḥ śāstu medinīm
analyzed: tvayā parigṛhītaḥ yam aṅgadaḥ śāstu medinīm
translated: When you have taken hold of this Angada, let him rule the earth for me.

original: saṃtatiś ca yathādṛṣṭā kṛtyaṃ yac cāpi sāmpratam
analyzed: saṃtatiḥ ca yathā dṛṣṭā kṛtyam yat ca api sāmpratam
translated: And let the line be continued as seen, and let the present duty be done.

original: rājñas tat kriyatāṃ sarvam eṣa kālasya niścayaḥ
analyzed: rājñaḥ tat kriyatām sarvam eṣa kālasya niścayaḥ
translated: Let all that be done for the king. This is the determination of time.

original: saṃskāryo harirājas tu aṅgadaś cābhiṣicyatām
analyzed: saṃskāryaḥ hari rājaḥ tu aṅgadaḥ ca abhiṣicyatām
translated: The king of the monkeys should be consecrated, and Angada should be anointed.

original: siṃhāsanagataṃ putraṃ paśyantī śāntim eṣyasi🔽sā tasya vacanaṃ śrutvā bhartṛvyasanapīḍitā
analyzed: siṃhāsana gatam putram paśyantī śāntim eṣyasi  sā tasya vacanam śrutvā bhartṛ vyasana pīḍitā
translated: Seeing your son seated on the throne, you will attain peace.🔽She, afflicted by the calamity that befell her husband,

original: abravīd uttaraṃ tārā hanūmantam avasthitam
analyzed: abravīt uttaram tārā hanūmantam avasthitam
translated: Hearing his words, Tara spoke to Hanumat who was standing there,

original: aṅgada pratirūpāṇāṃ putrāṇām ekataḥ śatam
analyzed: aṅgada pratirūpāṇām putrāṇām ekatas śatam
translated: Better than a hundred sons who are like Angada,

original: hatasyāpy asya vīrasya gātrasaṃśleṣaṇaṃ varam
analyzed: hatasya api asya vīrasya gātra saṃśleṣaṇam varam
translated: Is the embrace of the body of this slain hero.

original: na cāhaṃ harirājasya prabhavāmy aṅgadasya vā
analyzed: na ca aham hari rājasya prabhavāmi aṅgadasya vā
translated: And I am not under the control of the king of monkeys or Angada.

original: pitṛvyastasya sugrīvaḥ sarvakāryeṣv anantaraḥ
analyzed: pitṛ vyastasya sugrīvaḥ sarva kāryeṣu anantaraḥ
translated: His uncle Sugriva is next in command in all matters.

original: na hy eṣā buddhir āstheyā hanūmann aṅgadaṃ prati
analyzed: na hi eṣā buddhiḥ āstheyā hanūman aṅgadam prati
translated: O Hanumat! You should not entertain this idea about Angada.

original: pitā hi bandhuḥ putrasya na mātā harisattama
analyzed: pitā hi bandhuḥ putrasya na mātā hari sattama
translated: The father is the kinsman of the son, not the mother, O best of monkeys.

original: na hi mama harirājasaṃśrayāt /
analyzed: na hi mama hari rāja saṃśrayāt
translated: Due to my reliance on the king of monkeys,

original: kṣamataram asti paratra ceha vā🔽abhimukhahatavīrasevitaṃ /
analyzed: kṣamataram asti paratra ca iha vā  abhimukha hata vīra sevitam
translated: there is nothing more bearable for me in the next world or in this world.🔽This bed, frequented by heroes killed in the front,

original: śayanam idaṃ mama sevituṃ kṣamam
analyzed: śayanam idam mama sevitum kṣamam
translated: is fit for me to resort to.

original: vīkṣamāṇas tu mandāsuḥ sarvato mandam ucchvasan
analyzed: vīkṣamāṇaḥ tu mandāsuḥ sarvatas mandam ucchvasan
translated: Gazing all around, the slow-witted one sighed deeply.

original: ādāv eva tu sugrīvaṃ dadarśa tv ātmajāgrataḥ
analyzed: ādau eva tu sugrīvam dadarśa tu ātmaja agrataḥ
translated: But at the very beginning, he saw Sugriva, his son awake.

original: taṃ prāptavijayaṃ vālī sugrīvaṃ plavageśvaram
analyzed: tam prāpta vijayam vālī sugrīvam plavaga īśvaram
translated: Vali, having seen Sugriva, the lord of monkeys, victorious,

original: ābhāṣya vyaktayā vācā sasneham idam abravīt
analyzed: ābhāṣya vyaktayā vācā sa sneham idam abravīt
translated: spoke to him in a clear voice and affectionately said this:

original: sugrīvadoṣeṇa na māṃ gantum arhasi kilbiṣāt
analyzed: sugrīva doṣeṇa na mām gantum arhasi kilbiṣāt
translated: You should not go out of my fault, out of my sin.

original: kṛṣyamāṇaṃ bhaviṣyeṇa buddhimohena māṃ balāt
analyzed: kṛṣyamāṇam bhaviṣyeṇa buddhi mohena mām balāt
translated: I was forcibly dragged by the future, by the delusion of intelligence.

original: yugapadvihitaṃ tāta na manye sukham āvayoḥ
analyzed: yugapad vihitam tāta na manye sukham āvayoḥ
translated: I do not think, O father, that our happiness can be simultaneous.

original: sauhārdaṃ bhrātṛyuktaṃ hi tad idaṃ jātam anyathā
analyzed: sauhārdam bhrātṛ yuktam hi tat idam jātam anyathā
translated: This fraternal affection has become otherwise.

original: pratipadya tvam adyaiva rājyam eṣāṃ vanaukasām
analyzed: pratipadya tvam adyā eva rājyam eṣām vanaukasām
translated: Today itself, take up the kingdom of these forest-dwellers.

original: mām apy adyaiva gacchantaṃ viddhi vaivasvatakṣayam
analyzed: mām api adyā eva gacchantam viddhi vaivasvata kṣayam
translated: And today itself, know that I am going to Yama's abode.

original: jīvitaṃ ca hi rājyaṃ ca śriyaṃ ca vipulām imām
analyzed: jīvitam ca hi rājyam ca śriyam ca vipulām imām
translated: Life, kingdom, and this vast prosperity -

original: prajahāmy eṣa vai tūrṇaṃ mahac cāgarhitaṃ yaśaḥ
analyzed: prajahāmi eṣa vai tūrṇam mahat ca agarhitam yaśaḥ
translated: I am quickly abandoning all this, and also great, undeserved fame.

original: asyāṃ tv aham avasthāyāṃ vīra vakṣyāmi yad vacaḥ
analyzed: asyām tu aham avasthāyām vīra vakṣyāmi yat vacaḥ
translated: But in this situation, O hero, I will speak these words:

original: yady apy asukaraṃ rājan kartum eva tad arhasi
analyzed: yadi api asukaram rājan kartum eva tat arhasi
translated: Even if it is difficult to do, O king, you should do it.

original: sukhārhaṃ sukhasaṃvṛddhaṃ bālam enam abāliśam
analyzed: sukha arham sukha saṃvṛddham bālam enam a bāliśam
translated: This one deserves happiness, has grown up in comfort, is a child but not foolish.

original: bāṣpapūrṇamukhaṃ paśya bhūmau patitam aṅgadam
analyzed: bāṣpa pūrṇa mukham paśya bhūmau patitam aṅgadam
translated: Look at Angada, his face full of tears, fallen on the ground.

original: mama prāṇaiḥ priyataraṃ putraṃ putram ivaurasaṃ
analyzed: mama prāṇaiḥ priyataram putram putram iva aurasam
translated: He is dearer to me than my own life, like a son to a son.

original: mayā hīnam ahīnārthaṃ sarvataḥ paripālaya
analyzed: mayā hīnam ahīna artham sarvatas paripālaya
translated: Protect him in every way, even though he is without me, but not without purpose.

original: tvam apy asya hi dātā ca paritrātā ca sarvataḥ
analyzed: tvam api asya hi dātā ca paritrātā ca sarvatas
translated: You are his giver and protector in every way,

original: bhayeṣv abhayadaś caiva yathāhaṃ plavageśvara
analyzed: bhayeṣu abhaya daḥ ca eva yathā aham plavaga īśvara
translated: and the bestower of fearlessness in dangers, just as I am, O lord of monkeys.

original: eṣa tārātmajaḥ śrīmāṃs tvayā tulyaparākramaḥ
analyzed: eṣa tārā ātmajaḥ śrīmān tvayā tulya parākramaḥ
translated: This glorious son of Tara, equal to you in valor,

original: rakṣasāṃ tu vadhe teṣām agratas te bhaviṣyati
analyzed: rakṣasām tu vadhe teṣām agratas te bhaviṣyati
translated: will be at the forefront in the killing of those demons.

original: anurūpāṇi karmāṇi vikramya balavān raṇe
analyzed: anurūpāṇi karmāṇi vikramya balavān raṇe
translated: The powerful one, displaying his prowess in battle, will perform deeds worthy of him,

original: kariṣyaty eṣa tāreyas tarasvī taruṇo 'ṅgadaḥ
analyzed: kariṣyati eṣa tāreyaḥ tarasvī taruṇaḥ ṅgadaḥ
translated: This young and swift Angada, the son of Tara, will do it.

original: suṣeṇaduhitā ceyam arthasūkṣmaviniścaye
analyzed: suṣeṇa duhitā ca iyam artha sūkṣma viniścaye
translated: And this daughter of Sushena is well-versed in the subtle principles of artha,

original: autpātike ca vividhe sarvataḥ pariniṣṭhitā
analyzed: autpātike ca vividhe sarvatas pariniṣṭhitā
translated: and is well-trained in all kinds of omens.

original: yad eṣā sādhv iti brūyāt kāryaṃ tan muktasaṃśayam
analyzed: yat eṣā sādhu iti brūyāt kāryam tat mukta saṃśayam
translated: Whatever she declares to be good should be done without doubt.

original: na hi tārāmataṃ kiṃ cid anyathā parivartate
analyzed: na hi tārā matam kim cit anyathā parivartate
translated: Nothing that is done against the wishes of Tara ever turns out well.

original: rāghavasya ca te kāryaṃ kartavyam aviśaṅkayā
analyzed: rāghavasya ca te kāryam kartavyam aviśaṅkayā
translated: And you should do Raghava's work without hesitation.

original: syād adharmo hy akaraṇe tvāṃ ca hiṃsyād vimānitaḥ
analyzed: syāt adharmaḥ hi akaraṇe tvām ca hiṃsyāt vimānitaḥ
translated: For if you do not do it, it would be unrighteous, and if slighted, it would harm you.

original: imāṃ ca mālām ādhatsva divyāṃ sugrīvakāñcanīm
analyzed: imām ca mālām ādhatsva divyām sugrīva kāñcanīm
translated: And put on this divine golden garland of Sugriva.

original: udārā śrīḥ sthitā hy asyāṃ saṃprajahyān mṛte mayi
analyzed: udārā śrīḥ sthitā hi asyām saṃprajahyāt mṛte mayi
translated: For noble prosperity resides in it, which would leave me if I were to die.

original: ity evam uktaḥ sugrīvo vālinā bhrātṛsauhṛdāt
analyzed: iti evam uktaḥ sugrīvaḥ vālinā bhrātṛ sauhṛdāt
translated: Thus addressed by Vali out of fraternal affection,

original: harṣaṃ tyaktvā punar dīno grahagrasta ivoḍurāṭ
analyzed: harṣam tyaktvā punar dīnaḥ graha grastaḥ iva uḍurāj
translated: Sugriva, casting off his joy, again became dejected, like the moon afflicted by Rahu.

original: tad vālivacanāc chāntaḥ kurvan yuktam atandritaḥ🔽jagrāha so 'bhyanujñāto mālāṃ tāṃ caiva kāñcanīm
analyzed: tat vāli vacanāt śāntaḥ kurvan yuktam atandritaḥ  jagrāha saḥ bhyanujñātaḥ mālām tām ca eva kāñcanīm
translated: Then, pacified by Vali's words, doing what was proper and diligent,🔽he accepted the garland and the golden ornament, with Vali's permission.

original: tāṃ mālāṃ kāñcanīṃ dattvā vālī dṛṣṭvātmajaṃ sthitam
analyzed: tām mālām kāñcanīm dattvā vālī dṛṣṭvā ātmajam sthitam
translated: Having given the golden garland, Vali, seeing his son standing there,

original: saṃsiddhaḥ pretya bhāvāya snehād aṅgadam abravīt🔽deśakālau bhajasvādya kṣamamāṇaḥ priyāpriye
analyzed: saṃsiddhaḥ pretya bhāvāya snehāt aṅgadam abravīt  deśa kālau bhajasva adya kṣamamāṇaḥ priya apriye
translated: Having attained perfection, he spoke to Angada out of affection for his future well-being:🔽Now, accept the right time and place, enduring what is agreeable and disagreeable.

original: sukhaduḥkhasahaḥ kāle sugrīvavaśago bhava
analyzed: sukha duḥkha sahaḥ kāle sugrīva vaśa gaḥ bhava
translated: Enduring happiness and sorrow in due time, be under Sugriva's control.

original: yathā hi tvaṃ mahābāho lālitaḥ satataṃ mayā
analyzed: yathā hi tvam mahā bāho lālitaḥ satatam mayā
translated: O mighty-armed one, just as you have always been cherished by me,

original: na tathā vartamānaṃ tvāṃ sugrīvo bahu maṃsyate
analyzed: na tathā vartamānam tvām sugrīvaḥ bahu maṃsyate
translated: Sugriva will not value you much if you behave otherwise.

original: māsyāmitrair gataṃ gaccher mā śatrubhir ariṃdama
analyzed: mā asya amitraiḥ gatam gaccheḥ mā śatrubhiḥ ariṃdama
translated: O destroyer of enemies, do not go where your enemies have gone.

original: bhartur arthaparo dāntaḥ sugrīvavaśago bhava
analyzed: bhartuḥ artha paraḥ dāntaḥ sugrīva vaśa gaḥ bhava
translated: Be devoted to your master, self-controlled, and under Sugriva's control.

original: na cātipraṇayaḥ kāryaḥ kartavyo 'praṇayaś ca te
analyzed: na ca atipraṇayaḥ kāryaḥ praṇayaḥ ca te
translated: You should not show excessive affection, nor should you be indifferent.

original: ubhayaṃ hi mahādoṣaṃ tasmād antaradṛg bhava
analyzed: ubhayam hi mahā doṣam tasmāt antara dṛś bhava
translated: Both are greatly harmful, therefore, be impartial.

original: ity uktvātha vivṛttākṣaḥ śarasaṃpīḍito bhṛśam
analyzed: iti uktvā atha vivṛtta akṣaḥ śara saṃpīḍitaḥ bhṛśam
translated: Having said this, with eyes rolling and severely afflicted by the arrow,

original: vivṛtair daśanair bhīmair babhūvotkrāntajīvitaḥ
analyzed: vivṛtaiḥ daśanaiḥ bhīmaiḥ babhūva utkrānta jīvitaḥ
translated: he became lifeless with his terrible teeth bared.

original: hate tu vīre plavagādhipe tadā /
analyzed: hate tu vīre plavaga adhipe tadā
translated: When the heroic lord of the monkeys was thus killed,

original: plavaṃgamās tatra na śarma lebhire🔽vanecarāḥ siṃhayute mahāvane /
analyzed: plavaṃgamāḥ tatra na śarma lebhire  vanecarāḥ siṃha yute mahā vane
translated: the monkeys there found no peace.🔽Like forest-dwellers in a great forest infested with lions,

original: yathā hi gāvo nihate gavāṃ patau
analyzed: yathā hi gāvaḥ nihate gavām patau
translated: like cows when the lord of the cows is slain.

original: tatas tu tārā vyasanārṇava plutā /
analyzed: tatas tu tārā vyasana arṇava plutā
translated: Then Tara, floating in the ocean of calamity,

original: mṛtasyā bhartur vadanaṃ samīkṣya sā🔽jagāma bhūmiṃ parirabhya vālinaṃ /
analyzed: mṛtasyāḥ bhartuḥ vadanam samīkṣya sā  jagāma bhūmim parirabhya vālinam
translated: Seeing the face of her dead husband,🔽she went to the ground, embracing Vali.

original: mahādrumaṃ chinnam ivāśritā latā
analyzed: mahā drumam chinnam iva āśritā latā
translated: Like a creeper clinging to a great tree that has been cut down,

original: tataḥ samupajighrantī kapirājasya tanmukham
analyzed: tatas samupajighrantī kapi rājasya tat mukham
translated: she inhaled the face of the king of the monkeys,

original: patiṃ lokāc cyutaṃ tārā mṛtaṃ vacanam abravīt
analyzed: patim lokāt cyutam tārā mṛtam vacanam abravīt
translated: and Tara, whose husband had fallen from this world, spoke these words to the dead one:

original: śeṣe tvaṃ viṣame duḥkham akṛtvā vacanaṃ mama
analyzed: śeṣe tvam viṣame duḥkham a kṛtvā vacanam mama
translated: You lie in a difficult place, in sorrow, not having done what I said.

original: upalopacite vīra suduḥkhe vasudhātale
analyzed: upala upacite vīra su duḥkhe vasudhā tale
translated: O hero, on the ground covered with stones, very difficult to lie on.

original: mattaḥ priyatarā nūnaṃ vānarendra mahī tava
analyzed: mattaḥ priyatarā nūnam vānara indra mahī tava
translated: The earth must surely be dearer to you than me, O king of monkeys,

original: śeṣe hi tāṃ pariṣvajya māṃ ca na pratibhāṣase
analyzed: śeṣe hi tām pariṣvajya mām ca na pratibhāṣase
translated: for you lie embracing her, and do not reply to me.

original: sugrīva eva vikrānto vīra sāhasika priya
analyzed: sugrīvaḥ eva vikrāntaḥ vīra sāhasika priya
translated: Only Sugriva is valiant, O hero, who loves daring deeds.

original: ṛkṣavānaramukhyās tvāṃ balinaṃ paryupāsate
analyzed: ṛkṣa vānara mukhyāḥ tvām balinam paryupāsate
translated: The chief bears and monkeys attend on you, the powerful one.

original: eṣāṃ vilapitaṃ kṛcchram aṅgadasya ca śocataḥ
analyzed: eṣām vilapitam kṛcchram aṅgadasya ca śocataḥ
translated: Listen to the difficult lamentations of these, and of anguished Angada,

original: mama cemāṃ giraṃ śrutvā kiṃ tvaṃ na pratibudhyase🔽idaṃ tac chūraśayanaṃ yatra śeṣe hato yudhi
analyzed: mama ca imām giram śrutvā kim tvam na pratibudhyase  idam tat śūra śayanam yatra śeṣe hataḥ yudhi
translated: and why do you not wake up, having heard these words of mine?🔽This is the hero's bed where you lie, killed in battle.

original: śāyitā nihatā yatra tvayaiva ripavaḥ purā
analyzed: śāyitāḥ nihatāḥ yatra tvayā eva ripavaḥ purā
translated: Here you have lain down, having slain your enemies in the past.

original: viśuddhasattvābhijana priyayuddha mama priya
analyzed: viśuddha sattva abhijana priya yuddha mama priya
translated: O one of pure character and noble birth, who loves battle, who is dear to me,

original: mām anāthāṃ vihāyaikāṃ gatas tvam asi mānada
analyzed: mām anāthām vihāya ekām gataḥ tvam asi mānada
translated: O giver of honor, you have left me alone and helpless and gone away.

original: śūrāya na pradātavyā kanyā khalu vipaścitā🔽śūrabhāryāṃ hatāṃ paśya sadyo māṃ vidhavāṃ kṛtām
analyzed: śūrāya na pradātavyā kanyā khalu vipaścitā  śūra bhāryām hatām paśya sadyas mām vidhavām kṛtām
translated: A wise man should not give his daughter to a hero.🔽See, I have been made a widow instantly, with my heroic husband slain.

original: avabhagnaś ca me māno bhagnā me śāśvatī gatiḥ
analyzed: avabhagnaḥ ca me mānaḥ bhagnā me śāśvatī gatiḥ
translated: My pride is shattered, my eternal course is shattered.

original: agādhe ca nimagnāsmi vipule śokasāgare
analyzed: agādhe ca nimagnā asmi vipule śoka sāgare
translated: I am immersed in a fathomless, vast ocean of grief.

original: aśmasāramayaṃ nūnam idaṃ me hṛdayaṃ dṛḍham
analyzed: aśmasāra mayam nūnam idam me hṛdayam dṛḍham
translated: Surely this heart of mine is made of diamond,

original: bhartāraṃ nihataṃ dṛṣṭvā yan nādya śatadhā gatam
analyzed: bhartāram nihatam dṛṣṭvā yat na adya śatadhā gatam
translated: that it has not split into a hundred pieces today on seeing my husband slain.

original: suhṛc caiva hi bhartā ca prakṛtyā ca mama priyaḥ
analyzed: suhṛd ca eva hi bhartā ca prakṛtyā ca mama priyaḥ
translated: He was my friend, my husband, and naturally dear to me.

original: āhave ca parākrāntaḥ śūraḥ pañcatvam āgataḥ
analyzed: āhave ca parākrāntaḥ śūraḥ pañcatvam āgataḥ
translated: And he was a hero, valorous in battle, but now he has attained the state of the dead.

original: patihīnā tu yā nārī kāmaṃ bhavatu putriṇī
analyzed: pati hīnā tu yā nārī kāmam bhavatu putriṇī
translated: A woman who is without a husband, even if she has sons as she wishes,

original: dhanadhānyaiḥ supūrṇāpi vidhavety ucyate budhaiḥ🔽svagātraprabhave vīra śeṣe rudhiramaṇḍale
analyzed: dhana dhānyaiḥ su pūrṇā api vidhavā iti ucyate budhaiḥ  sva gātra prabhave vīra śeṣe rudhira maṇḍale
translated: is called a widow by the wise, even if she is well-filled with wealth and grain.🔽O hero, on a bed of blood that has arisen from your own body,

original: kṛmirāgaparistome tvam evaṃ śayane yathā
analyzed: kṛmirāgaparistome tvam evam śayane yathā
translated: enveloped by the red color of worms, you lie down like this.

original: reṇuśoṇitasaṃvītaṃ gātraṃ tava samantataḥ
analyzed: reṇu śoṇita saṃvītam gātram tava samantataḥ
translated: Your body is covered all over with dust and blood,

original: parirabdhuṃ na śaknomi bhujābhyāṃ plavagarṣabha
analyzed: parirabdhum na śaknomi bhujābhyām plavaga ṛṣabha
translated: I am unable to embrace you with my arms, O bull among monkeys.

original: kṛtakṛtyo 'dya sugrīvo vaire 'sminn atidāruṇe
analyzed: kṛtakṛtyaḥ sugrīvaḥ vaire smin ati dāruṇe
translated: Sugriva has accomplished his purpose today in this extremely terrible enmity,

original: yasya rāmavimuktena hṛtam ekeṣuṇā bhayam
analyzed: yasya rāma vimuktena hṛtam eka iṣuṇā bhayam
translated: whose fear was taken away by a single arrow released by Rama.

original: śareṇa hṛdi lagnena gātrasaṃsparśane tava
analyzed: śareṇa hṛdi lagnena gātra saṃsparśane tava
translated: With an arrow stuck in your chest, when you touch my body,

original: vāryāmi tvāṃ nirīkṣantī tvayi pañcatvam āgate
analyzed: tvām nirīkṣantī tvayi pañcatvam āgate
translated: I forbid you, seeing you, when you have become dead.

original: udbabarha śaraṃ nīlas tasya gātragataṃ tadā
analyzed: śaram nīlaḥ tasya gātra gatam tadā
translated: Nila then extracted the arrow that was lodged in his body,

original: girigahvarasaṃlīnaṃ dīptam āśīviṣaṃ yathā
analyzed: giri gahvara saṃlīnam dīptam āśīviṣam yathā
translated: like a blazing poisonous snake hidden in a mountain cave.

original: tasya niṣkṛṣyamāṇasya bāṇasya ca babhau dyutiḥ
analyzed: tasya niṣkṛṣyamāṇasya bāṇasya ca babhau dyutiḥ
translated: The radiance of the arrow being extracted was seen,

original: astamastakasaṃruddho raśmir dinakarād iva
analyzed: asta mastaka saṃruddhaḥ raśmiḥ dinakarāt iva
translated: like the rays of the sun obstructed by the western mountain peak.

original: petuḥ kṣatajadhārās tu vraṇebhyas tasya sarvaśaḥ
analyzed: petuḥ kṣataja dhārāḥ tu vraṇebhyaḥ tasya sarvaśas
translated: Streams of blood flowed from all his wounds,

original: tāmragairikasaṃpṛktā dhārā iva dharādharāt🔽avakīrṇaṃ vimārjantī bhartāraṃ raṇareṇunā
analyzed: tāmra gairika saṃpṛktāḥ dhārāḥ iva dharādharāt  avakīrṇam vimārjantī bhartāram raṇa reṇunā
translated: like streams of red chalk flowing from a mountain.🔽Shedding the battle dust from her husband,

original: asrair nayanajaiḥ śūraṃ siṣecāstrasamāhatam
analyzed: asraiḥ nayana jaiḥ śūram siṣeca astra samāhatam
translated: she sprinkled the heroic one struck by weapons with tears from her eyes.

original: rudhirokṣitasarvāṅgaṃ dṛṣṭvā vinihataṃ patim
analyzed: rudhira ukṣita sarva aṅgam dṛṣṭvā vinihatam patim
translated: Seeing her husband slain, his entire body covered in blood,

original: uvāca tārā piṅgākṣaṃ putram aṅgadam aṅganā
analyzed: uvāca tārā piṅga akṣam putram aṅgadam aṅganā
translated: the woman Tara spoke to her son Angada, the tawny-eyed one:

original: avasthāṃ paścimāṃ paśya pituḥ putra sudāruṇām
analyzed: avasthām paścimām paśya pituḥ putra su dāruṇām
translated: Behold, O son, this terrible last state of your father.

original: saṃprasaktasya vairasya gato 'ntaḥ pāpakarmaṇā
analyzed: saṃprasaktasya vairasya gataḥ ntaḥ pāpa karmaṇā
translated: The end of the enmity that has arisen has been reached by the one of sinful deeds.

original: bālasūryodayatanuṃ prayāntaṃ yamasādanam
analyzed: bāla sūrya udaya tanum prayāntam yama sādanam
translated: Going to Yama's abode, with a body like the rising sun,

original: abhivādaya rājānaṃ pitaraṃ putra mānadam
analyzed: abhivādaya rājānam pitaram putra mānadam
translated: Salute your father, the king, the bestower of honor, O son.

original: evam uktaḥ samutthāya jagrāha caraṇau pituḥ
analyzed: evam uktaḥ samutthāya jagrāha caraṇau pituḥ
translated: Thus addressed, he arose and grasped his father's feet,

original: bhujābhyāṃ pīnavṛtābhyām aṅgado 'ham iti bruvan🔽abhivādayamānaṃ tvām aṅgadaṃ tvaṃ yathāpurā
analyzed: bhujābhyām pīna vṛtābhyām aṅgadaḥ ham iti bruvan  abhivādayamānam tvām aṅgadam tvam yathā purā
translated: with his stout and round arms, saying, I am Angada.

original: dīrghāyur bhava putreti kimarthaṃ nābhibhāṣase
analyzed: dīrgha āyuḥ bhava putra iti kimartham na abhibhāṣase
translated: Why do you not address me as before, saying, 'May you live long, O son,'

original: ahaṃ putrasahāyā tvām upāse gatacetanam
analyzed: aham putra sahāyā tvām upāse gata cetanam
translated: as I attend upon you, bereft of consciousness, with my son as my companion,

original: siṃhena nihataṃ sadyo gauḥ savatseva govṛṣam
analyzed: siṃhena nihatam sadyas gauḥ sa vatsā iva go vṛṣam
translated: like a cow with her calf to a bull slain by a lion?

original: iṣṭvā saṃgrāmayajñena nānāpraharaṇāmbhasā
analyzed: iṣṭvā saṃgrāma yajñena nānā praharaṇa ambhasā
translated: Having performed the sacrifice of battle with various weapons as the oblation,

original: asminn avabhṛthe snātaḥ kathaṃ patnyā mayā vinā
analyzed: asmin avabhṛthe snātaḥ katham patnyā mayā vinā
translated: how is it that I, your wife, am not present at this concluding bath?

original: yā dattā devarājena tava tuṣṭena saṃyuge
analyzed: yā dattā devarājena tava tuṣṭena saṃyuge
translated: The golden garland given to you by the king of the gods, being pleased with you in battle,

original: śātakumbhamayīṃ mālāṃ tāṃ te paśyāmi neha kim
analyzed: śātakumbha mayīm mālām tām te paśyāmi na iha kim
translated: why do I not see it here?

original: rājaśrīr na jahāti tvāṃ gatāsum api mānada
analyzed: rāja śrīḥ na jahāti tvām gatāsum api mānada
translated: O bestower of honor, the royal glory does not forsake you even in death,

original: sūryasyāvartamānasya śailarājam iva prabhā
analyzed: sūryasya āvartamānasya śailarājam iva prabhā
translated: like the radiance of the sun to the king of mountains.

original: na me vacaḥ pathyam idaṃ tvayā kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: na me vacaḥ pathyam idam tvayā kṛtam
translated: You have not acted according to my beneficial words.

original: na cāsmi śaktā hi nivāraṇe tava
analyzed: na ca asmi śaktā hi nivāraṇe tava
translated: And I am not able to restrain you,

original: hatā saputrāsmi hatena saṃyuge /
analyzed: hatā sa putrā asmi hatena saṃyuge
translated: I am slain, with my son slain in battle.

original: saha tvayā śrīr vijahāti mām iha
analyzed: saha tvayā śrīḥ vijahāti mām iha
translated: With you gone, prosperity abandons me here.

original: gatāsuṃ vālinaṃ dṛṣṭvā rāghavas tadanantaram
analyzed: gatāsum vālinam dṛṣṭvā rāghavaḥ tad anantaram
translated: Seeing Vāli dead, Rāghava, the tormentor of enemies,

original: abravīt praśritaṃ vākyaṃ sugrīvaṃ śatrutāpanaḥ
analyzed: abravīt praśritam vākyam sugrīvam śatru tāpanaḥ
translated: spoke these gentle words to Sugrīva:

original: na śokaparitāpena śreyasā yujyate mṛtaḥ
analyzed: na śoka paritāpena śreyasā yujyate mṛtaḥ
translated: The dead do not attain welfare through grief and sorrow.

original: yad atrānantaraṃ kāryaṃ tat samādhātum arhatha
analyzed: yat atra anantaram kāryam tat samādhātum arhatha
translated: You should now consider what should be done next.

original: lokavṛttam anuṣṭheyaṃ kṛtaṃ vo bāṣpamokṣaṇam
analyzed: loka vṛttam anuṣṭheyam kṛtam vaḥ bāṣpa mokṣaṇam
translated: The shedding of tears is a worldly practice that you have done.

original: na kālād uttaraṃ kiṃ cit karma śakyam upāsitum
analyzed: na kālāt uttaram kim cit karma śakyam upāsitum
translated: No action can be performed beyond the proper time.

original: niyataḥ kāraṇaṃ loke niyatiḥ karmasādhanam
analyzed: niyataḥ kāraṇam loke niyatiḥ karma sādhanam
translated: In the world, destiny is the cause, and destiny is the means of action.

original: niyatiḥ sarvabhūtānāṃ niyogeṣv iha kāraṇam
analyzed: niyatiḥ sarva bhūtānām niyogeṣu iha kāraṇam
translated: Destiny is the cause of all beings in their engagements here.

original: na kartā kasya cit kaś cin niyoge cāpi neśvaraḥ
analyzed: na kartā kasya cit kaḥ cit niyoge ca api na īśvaraḥ
translated: No one is the agent of anything, and there is no controller in engagement.

original: svabhāve vartate lokas tasya kālaḥ parāyaṇam
analyzed: svabhāve vartate lokaḥ tasya kālaḥ parāyaṇam
translated: The world abides in its own nature, and time is its ultimate resort.

original: na kālaḥ kālam atyeti na kālaḥ parihīyate
analyzed: na kālaḥ kālam atyeti na kālaḥ parihīyate
translated: Time never exceeds its proper time, nor does time diminish.

original: svabhāvaṃ vā samāsādya na kaś cid ativartate
analyzed: svabhāvam vā samāsādya na kaḥ cit ativartate
translated: No one ever goes beyond its nature.

original: na kālasyāsti bandhutvaṃ na hetur na parākramaḥ
analyzed: na kālasya asti bandhu tvam na hetuḥ na parākramaḥ
translated: Time has no friendship, no cause, no valor,

original: na mitrajñātisaṃbandhaḥ kāraṇaṃ nātmano vaśaḥ
analyzed: na mitra jñāti saṃbandhaḥ kāraṇam na ātmanaḥ vaśaḥ
translated: Friends, relatives, and kinship are not the cause, nor is one's own power.

original: kiṃ tu kāla parīṇāmo draṣṭavyaḥ sādhu paśyatā
analyzed: kim tu kāla parīṇāmaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ sādhu paśyatā
translated: But a good observer should see that it is the change of time.

original: dharmaś cārthaś ca kāmaś ca kālakramasamāhitāḥ
analyzed: dharmaḥ ca arthaḥ ca kāmaḥ ca kāla krama samāhitāḥ
translated: Dharma, artha, and kama, when combined in due order,

original: itaḥ svāṃ prakṛtiṃ vālī gataḥ prāptaḥ kriyāphalam
analyzed: itas svām prakṛtim vālī gataḥ prāptaḥ kriyā phalam
translated: From here, Vali has gone to his own nature, and has attained the fruit of his actions.

original: dharmārthakāmasaṃyogaiḥ pavitraṃ plavageśvara
analyzed: dharma artha kāma saṃyogaiḥ pavitram plavaga īśvara
translated: O lord of the monkeys, this is the purification through the combination of dharma, artha, and kama.

original: svadharmasya ca saṃyogāj jitas tena mahātmanā
analyzed: svadharmasya ca saṃyogāt jitaḥ tena mahātmanā
translated: And because of his association with his own dharma, that great soul has conquered.

original: svargaḥ parigṛhītaś ca prāṇān aparirakṣatā
analyzed: svargaḥ parigṛhītaḥ ca prāṇān a parirakṣatā
translated: And by not protecting his life, he has attained heaven.

original: eṣā vai niyatiḥ śreṣṭhā yāṃ gato hariyūthapaḥ
analyzed: eṣā vai niyatiḥ śreṣṭhā yām gataḥ hari yūthapaḥ
translated: This is indeed the best destiny, to which the leader of the monkey troop has gone.

original: tad alaṃ paritāpena prāptakālam upāsyatām
analyzed: tat alam paritāpena prāpta kālam upāsyatām
translated: Therefore, enough of lamenting. Let us attend to what is to be done at the right time.

original: vacanānte tu rāmasya lakṣmaṇaḥ paravīrahā🔽avadat praśritaṃ vākyaṃ sugrīvaṃ gatacetasaṃ
analyzed: vacana ante tu rāmasya lakṣmaṇaḥ para vīra hā  avadat praśritam vākyam sugrīvam gata cetasam
translated: At the end of Rama's words, Lakshmana, the slayer of enemy heroes,🔽Spoke these gentle words to Sugriva, who had lost his senses:

original: kuru tvam asya sugrīva pretakāryam anantaram
analyzed: kuru tvam asya sugrīva pretakāryam anantaram
translated: O Sugriva, perform the funeral rites for him immediately.

original: tārāṅgadābhyāṃ sahito vālino dahanaṃ prati
analyzed: tārā aṅgadābhyām sahitaḥ vālinaḥ dahanam prati
translated: Together with Tara and Angada, for the cremation of Vali.

original: samājñāpaya kāṣṭhāni śuṣkāṇi ca bahūni ca
analyzed: samājñāpaya kāṣṭhāni śuṣkāṇi ca bahūni ca
translated: Give orders for a lot of dry wood

original: candanāni ca divyāni vālisaṃskārakāraṇāt
analyzed: candanāni ca divyāni vāli saṃskāra kāraṇāt
translated: And divine sandalwood for the funeral rites of Vali.

original: samāśvāsaya cainaṃ tvam aṅgadaṃ dīnacetasaṃ
analyzed: samāśvāsaya ca enam tvam aṅgadam dīna cetasam
translated: And console this Angada, whose mind is distressed.

original: mā bhūr bāliśabuddhis tvaṃ tvadadhīnam idaṃ puram
analyzed: mā bhūḥ bāliśa buddhiḥ tvam tvad adhīnam idam puram
translated: Do not be foolish, for this city depends on you.

original: aṅgadas tv ānayen mālyaṃ vastrāṇi vividhāni ca
analyzed: aṅgadaḥ tu ānayet mālyam vastrāṇi vividhāni ca
translated: But Angada will bring garlands and various garments,

original: ghṛtaṃ tailam atho gandhān yac cātra samanantaram
analyzed: ghṛtam tailam atho gandhān yat ca atra samanantaram
translated: ghee, oil, and perfumes, and whatever else is necessary here.

original: tvaṃ tāra śibikāṃ śīghram ādāyāgaccha saṃbhramāt
analyzed: tvam tāra śibikām śīghram ādāya āgaccha saṃbhramāt
translated: O Tara, quickly take the palanquin and come here in haste.

original: tvarā guṇavatī yuktā hy asmin kāle viśeṣataḥ🔽sajjībhavantu plavagāḥ śibikāvāhanocitāḥ
analyzed: tvarā guṇavatī yuktā hi asmin kāle viśeṣataḥ  sajjībhavantu plavagāḥ śibikā vāhana ucitāḥ
translated: Haste is especially appropriate at this time.🔽Let the monkeys who are fit to carry the palanquin get ready.

original: samarthā balinaś caiva nirhariṣyanti vālinam
analyzed: samarthāḥ balinaḥ ca eva nirhariṣyanti vālinam
translated: They will be able to carry Vali away.

original: evam uktvā tu sugrīvaṃ sumitrānandavardhanaḥ
analyzed: evam uktvā tu sugrīvam sumitrā ānanda vardhanaḥ
translated: Having thus spoken to Sugriva, the enhancer of Sumitra's joy,

original: tasthau bhrātṛsamīpastho lakṣmaṇaḥ paravīrahā
analyzed: tasthau bhrātṛ samīpa sthaḥ lakṣmaṇaḥ para vīra hā
translated: Lakshmana, the slayer of enemy heroes, stood near his brother.

original: lakṣmaṇasya vacaḥ śrutvā tāraḥ saṃbhrāntamānasaḥ🔽praviveśa guhāṃ śīghraṃ śibikāsaktamānasaḥ
analyzed: lakṣmaṇasya vacaḥ śrutvā tāraḥ saṃbhrānta mānasaḥ  praviveśa guhām śīghram śibikā sakta mānasaḥ
translated: Hearing Lakshmana's words, Tara, with a disturbed mind,🔽quickly entered the cave, her mind fixed on the palanquin.

original: ādāya śibikāṃ tāraḥ sa tu paryāpayat punaḥ
analyzed: ādāya śibikām tāraḥ sa tu paryāpayat punar
translated: Taking the palanquin, Tara again had it carried by the monkeys,

original: vānarair uhyamānāṃ tāṃ śūrair udvahanocitaiḥ
analyzed: vānaraiḥ uhyamānām tām śūraiḥ udvahana ucitaiḥ
translated: who were strong and capable of carrying it, and who were being carried by heroic monkeys.

original: tato vālinam udyamya sugrīvaḥ śibikāṃ tadā
analyzed: tatas vālinam udyamya sugrīvaḥ śibikām tadā
translated: Then Sugriva, lifting up Vali, placed him on the palanquin,

original: āropayata vikrośann aṅgadena sahaiva tu
analyzed: āropayata vikrośan aṅgadena saha eva tu
translated: And had him carried on a litter, lamenting along with Angada.

original: āropya śibikāṃ caiva vālinaṃ gatajīvitam
analyzed: āropya śibikām ca eva vālinam gata jīvitam
translated: Having had the lifeless Vali carried on a litter,

original: alaṃkāraiś ca vividhair mālyair vastraiś ca bhūṣitam
analyzed: alaṃkāraiḥ ca vividhaiḥ mālyaiḥ vastraiḥ ca bhūṣitam
translated: Adorned with various ornaments, garlands, and garments,

original: ājñāpayat tadā rājā sugrīvaḥ plavageśvaraḥ
analyzed: ājñāpayat tadā rājā sugrīvaḥ plavaga īśvaraḥ
translated: King Sugriva, the lord of the monkeys, commanded:

original: aurdhvadehikam āryasya kriyatām anurūpataḥ
analyzed: aurdhvadehikam āryasya kriyatām anurūpatas
translated: Perform the funeral rites for the noble one, befittingly.

original: viśrāṇayanto ratnāni vividhāni bahūni ca
analyzed: ratnāni vividhāni bahūni ca
translated: Distributing various jewels and many gems,

original: agrataḥ plavagā yāntu śibikā tadanantaram
analyzed: agratas plavagāḥ yāntu śibikā tad anantaram
translated: Let the monkeys go in front, and the litter after that.

original: rājñām ṛddhiviśeṣā hi dṛśyante bhuvi yādṛśāḥ
analyzed: rājñām ṛddhi viśeṣāḥ hi dṛśyante bhuvi yādṛśāḥ
translated: For the special prosperity of kings is seen on earth,

original: tādṛśaṃ vālinaḥ kṣipraṃ prākurvann aurdhvadehikam
analyzed: tādṛśam vālinaḥ kṣipram prākurvan aurdhvadehikam
translated: So quickly perform Vali's funeral rites in that way.

original: aṅgadam aprigṛhyāśu tāraprabhṛtayas tathā🔽krośantaḥ prayayuḥ sarve vānarā hatabāndhavāḥ
analyzed: aṅgadam a prigṛhya āśu tāra prabhṛtayaḥ tathā  krośantaḥ prayayuḥ sarve vānarāḥ hata bāndhavāḥ
translated: Quickly taking hold of Angada, and Tara and the others,🔽All the monkeys, their kinsmen slain, went forth, lamenting.

original: tārāprabhṛtayaḥ sarvā vānaryo hatayūthapāḥ
analyzed: tārā prabhṛtayaḥ sarvāḥ vānaryaḥ hata yūthapāḥ
translated: All the female monkeys, led by Tara, with their leaders slain,

original: anujagmur hi bhartāraṃ krośantyaḥ karuṇasvanāḥ
analyzed: anujagmuḥ hi bhartāram krośantyaḥ karuṇa svanāḥ
translated: Followed their lord, lamenting in piteous voices.

original: tāsāṃ ruditaśabdena vānarīṇāṃ vanāntare
analyzed: tāsām rudita śabdena vānarīṇām vana antare
translated: By the weeping sounds of those female monkeys in the forest,

original: vanāni girayaḥ sarve vikrośantīva sarvataḥ
analyzed: vanāni girayaḥ sarve vikrośanti iva sarvatas
translated: The forests and all the mountains seemed to wail everywhere.

original: puline girinadyās tu vivikte jalasaṃvṛte
analyzed: puline giri nadyāḥ tu vivikte jala saṃvṛte
translated: On the bank of a mountain stream, in a secluded place covered with water,

original: citāṃ cakruḥ subahavo vānarā vanacāriṇaḥ
analyzed: citām cakruḥ su bahavaḥ vānarāḥ vana cāriṇaḥ
translated: Many monkeys, wanderers of the forest, made a pyre.

original: avaropya tataḥ skandhāc chibikāṃ vahanocitāḥ
analyzed: avaropya tatas skandhāt śibikām vahana ucitāḥ
translated: Then, having taken down the palanquin from their shoulders, those fit for carrying,

original: tasthur ekāntam āśritya sarve śokasamanvitāḥ
analyzed: tasthuḥ ekāntam āśritya sarve śoka samanvitāḥ
translated: all of them, filled with sorrow, stood aside.

original: tatas tārā patiṃ dṛṣṭvā śibikātalaśāyinam
analyzed: tatas tārā patim dṛṣṭvā śibikā tala śāyinam
translated: Then Tara, seeing her husband lying on the ground of the palanquin,

original: āropyāṅke śiras tasya vilalāpa suduḥkhitā🔽janaṃ ca paśyasīmaṃ tvaṃ kasmāc chokābhipīḍitam
analyzed: āropya aṅke śiraḥ tasya vilalāpa su duḥkhitā  janam ca paśyasi imam tvam kasmāt śoka abhipīḍitam
translated: placing his head on her lap, lamented in great sorrow:🔽Do you see this people afflicted with grief?

original: prahṛṣṭam iva te vaktraṃ gatāsor api mānada
analyzed: prahṛṣṭam iva te vaktram gatāsoḥ api mānada
translated: Your face, O giver of honor, seems to be cheerful even though you have lost your life.

original: astārkasamavarṇaṃ ca lakṣyate jīvato yathā
analyzed: asta arka sama varṇam ca lakṣyate jīvataḥ yathā
translated: It appears to be of the color of the setting sun, as if you were alive.

original: eṣa tvāṃ rāmarūpeṇa kālaḥ karṣati vānara
analyzed: eṣa tvām rāma rūpeṇa kālaḥ karṣati vānara
translated: This Death, in the form of Rama, is dragging you away, O monkey,

original: yena sma vidhavāḥ sarvāḥ kṛtā ekeṣuṇā raṇe
analyzed: yena sma vidhavāḥ sarvāḥ kṛtāḥ eka iṣuṇā raṇe
translated: by whom all of us have been widowed, by a single arrow in battle.

original: imās tās tava rājendravānaryo vallabhāḥ sadā
analyzed: imāḥ tāḥ tava rāja indra vānaryaḥ vallabhāḥ sadā
translated: These are your beloved wives, O king of monkeys, always dear to you.

original: pādair vikṛṣṭam adhvānam āgatāḥ kiṃ na budhyase
analyzed: pādaiḥ vikṛṣṭam adhvānam āgatāḥ kim na budhyase
translated: Do you not understand that they have come a long distance on foot?

original: taveṣṭā nanu nāmaitā bhāryāś candranibhānanāḥ
analyzed: tava iṣṭāḥ nanu nāma etāḥ bhāryāḥ candra nibha ānanāḥ
translated: Surely these wives of yours, with faces like the moon, are dear to you.

original: idānīṃ nekṣase kasmāt sugrīvaṃ plavageśvaram
analyzed: idānīm nā īkṣase kasmāt sugrīvam plavaga īśvaram
translated: Why do you not see Sugriva, the lord of the monkeys, now?

original: ete hi sacivā rājaṃs tāraprabhṛtayas tava

translated: These are your ministers, O king, Tara and others.

original: puravāsijanaś cāyaṃ parivāryāsate 'nagha
analyzed: pura vāsi janaḥ ca ayam parivārya āsate nagha
translated: And this populace of the city, O sinless one, is waiting around.

original: visarjayainān pravalān yathocitam ariṃdama
analyzed: visarjaya enān pravalān yathocitam ariṃdama
translated: Send away these powerful ones, O chastiser of foes, as is proper.

original: tataḥ krīḍāmahe sarvā vaneṣu madirotkaṭāḥ
analyzed: tatas krīḍāmahe sarvāḥ vaneṣu madirā utkaṭāḥ
translated: Then we shall all sport in the forests, intoxicated and excited.

original: evaṃ vilapatīṃ tārāṃ patiśokapariplutām
analyzed: evam vilapatīm tārām pati śoka pariplutām
translated: Thus did Tara lament, overwhelmed with grief for her husband.

original: utthāpayanti sma tadā vānaryaḥ śokakarśitāḥ🔽sugrīveṇa tataḥ sārdham aṅgadaḥ pitaraṃ rudan
analyzed: utthāpayanti sma tadā vānaryaḥ śoka karśitāḥ  sugrīveṇa tatas sārdham aṅgadaḥ pitaram rudan
translated: The female monkeys, emaciated with grief, raised her up then.🔽Then Angada, weeping with Sugriva,

original: citām āropayām āsa śokenābhihatendriyaḥ
analyzed: citām āropayām āsa śokena abhihata indriyaḥ
translated: placed his father's body on the funeral pyre, his senses overwhelmed with sorrow.

original: tato 'gniṃ vidhivad dattvā so 'pasavyaṃ cakāra ha
analyzed: tatas gnim vidhivat dattvā saḥ pasavyam cakāra ha
translated: Then, having duly offered the fire, he circumambulated it.

original: pitaraṃ dīrgham adhvānaṃ prasthitaṃ vyākulendriyaḥ
analyzed: pitaram dīrgham adhvānam prasthitam vyākula indriyaḥ
translated: With his senses agitated, he saw his father set out on a long journey.

original: saṃskṛtya vālinaṃ te tu vidhipūrvaṃ plavaṃgamāḥ
analyzed: saṃskṛtya vālinam te tu vidhi pūrvam plavaṃgamāḥ
translated: Having duly cremated Vali, the monkeys

analyzed: ājagmuḥ udakam kartum nadīm śīta jalām śubhām
translated: went to perform the water rite in a river with cool, auspicious waters.

original: tatas te sahitās tatra aṅgadaṃ sthāpya cāgrataḥ
analyzed: tatas te sahitāḥ tatra aṅgadam sthāpya ca agratas
translated: Then, placing Angada in front, they,

original: sugrīvatārāsahitāḥ siṣicur vāline jalam
analyzed: sugrīva tārā sahitāḥ siṣicuḥ vāline jalam
translated: together with Sugriva and Tara, sprinkled the water on Vali.

original: sugrīveṇaiva dīnena dīno bhūtvā mahābalaḥ
analyzed: sugrīveṇa eva dīnena dīnaḥ bhūtvā mahā balaḥ
translated: The mighty one, already distressed, became even more distressed on account of the distressed Sugriva.

original: samānaśokaḥ kākutsthaḥ pretakāryāṇy akārayat
analyzed: samāna śokaḥ kākutsthaḥ pretakāryāṇi akārayat
translated: Kakutstha, sharing his sorrow, performed the funeral rites.

original: tataḥ śokābhisaṃtaptaṃ sugrīvaṃ klinnavāsanam
analyzed: tatas śoka abhisaṃtaptam sugrīvam klinna vāsanam
translated: Then Sugriva, tormented by grief, his clothes wet,

original: śākhāmṛgamahāmātrāḥ parivāryopatasthire
analyzed: śākhāmṛga mahāmātrāḥ parivārya upatasthire
translated: was attended by the great ministers of the monkeys, surrounding him.

original: abhigamya mahābāhuṃ rāmam akliṣṭakāriṇam
analyzed: abhigamya mahā bāhum rāmam akliṣṭa kāriṇam
translated: Approaching the mighty-armed Rama, the performer of difficult deeds,

original: sthitāḥ prāñjalayaḥ sarve pitāmaham ivarṣayaḥ
analyzed: sthitāḥ prāñjalayaḥ sarve pitāmaham iva ṛṣayaḥ
translated: all of them stood with folded hands, like the sages before the grandfather.

original: tataḥ kāñcanaśailābhas taruṇārkanibhānanaḥ
analyzed: tatas kāñcana śaila ābhaḥ taruṇa arka nibha ānanaḥ
translated: Then the one resembling a golden mountain, his face like the rising sun,

analyzed: abravīt prāñjaliḥ vākyam hanumān mārutātmajaḥ  bhavat prasādāt sugrīvaḥ pitṛpaitāmaham mahat
translated: Hanuman, the son of the wind god, spoke with folded hands:🔽By your grace, Sugriva has obtained this great kingdom of the monkeys,

original: vānarāṇāṃ suduṣprāpaṃ prāpto rājyam idaṃ prabho
analyzed: vānarāṇām suduṣprāpam prāptaḥ rājyam idam prabho
translated: difficult to attain, belonging to his father and grandfather, O lord.

original: bhavatā samanujñātaḥ praviśya nagaraṃ śubham
analyzed: bhavatā samanujñātaḥ praviśya nagaram śubham
translated: Permitted by you, he will enter the auspicious city

original: saṃvidhāsyati kāryāṇi sarvāṇi sasuhṛjjanaḥ
analyzed: saṃvidhāsyati kāryāṇi sarvāṇi sa suhṛd janaḥ
translated: and arrange all the tasks, along with his friends and people.

original: snāto 'yaṃ vividhair gandhair auṣadhaiś ca yathāvidhi
analyzed: snātaḥ yam vividhaiḥ gandhaiḥ auṣadhaiḥ ca yathāvidhi
translated: He has bathed and is anointed with various fragrances and herbs, according to the rules.

original: arcayiṣyati ratnaiś ca mālyaiś ca tvāṃ viśeṣataḥ
analyzed: arcayiṣyati ratnaiḥ ca mālyaiḥ ca tvām viśeṣataḥ
translated: He will especially worship you with jewels and garlands.

original: imāṃ giriguhāṃ ramyām abhigantum ito 'rhasi
analyzed: imām giri guhām ramyām abhigantum itas rhasi
translated: You should go to this beautiful mountain cave from here.

original: kuruṣva svāmi saṃbandhaṃ vānarān saṃpraharṣayan
analyzed: kuruṣva svāmi saṃbandham vānarān saṃpraharṣayan

original: evam ukto hanumatā rāghavaḥ paravīrahā
analyzed: evam uktaḥ hanumatā rāghavaḥ para vīra hā

analyzed: pratyuvāca hanūmantam buddhimān vākya kovidaḥ

analyzed: caturdaśa samāḥ saumya grāmam vā yadi vā puram
translated: For fourteen years, O gentle one, whether in a village or a city,

analyzed: na pravekṣyāmi hanuman pituḥ nirdeśa pālakaḥ
translated: I will not enter, O Hanumat, as I am observing my father's command.

original: susamṛddhāṃ guhāṃ divyāṃ sugrīvo vānararṣabhaḥ
analyzed: su samṛddhām guhām divyām sugrīvaḥ vānara ṛṣabhaḥ

original: praviṣṭo vidhivad vīraḥ kṣipraṃ rājye 'bhiṣicyatām
analyzed: praviṣṭaḥ vidhivat vīraḥ kṣipram rājye bhiṣicyatām

original: evam uktvā hanūmantaṃ rāmaḥ sugrīvam abravīt
analyzed: evam uktvā hanūmantam rāmaḥ sugrīvam abravīt

analyzed: imam api aṅgadam vīra yauvarājye bhiṣecaya
translated: Consecrate this hero Angada as the heir apparent.

analyzed: pūrvaḥ yam vārṣikaḥ māsaḥ śrāvaṇaḥ salila āgamaḥ
translated: This is the first month of the rainy season, the month of Sravana, the arrival of the rains.

original: pravṛttāḥ saumya catvāro māsā vārṣikasaṃjñitāḥ
analyzed: pravṛttāḥ saumya catvāraḥ māsāḥ vārṣika saṃjñitāḥ
translated: O gentle one, the four months known as the rainy season have begun.

analyzed: na ayam udyoga samayaḥ praviśa tvam purīm śubhām

original: asmin vatsyāmy ahaṃ saumya parvate sahalakṣmaṇaḥ
analyzed: asmin vatsyāmi aham saumya parvate sahalakṣmaṇaḥ

original: iyaṃ giriguhā ramyā viśālā yuktamārutā
analyzed: iyam giri guhā ramyā viśālā yukta mārutā

original: prabhūtasalilā saumya prabhūtakamalotpalā
analyzed: prabhūta salilā saumya prabhūta kamala utpalā
translated: O gentle one, it has plenty of water, and plenty of lotuses and lilies.

analyzed: kārtike samanuprāpte tvam rāvaṇa vadhe yata
translated: When Kartika arrives, strive for Ravana's destruction.

original: eṣa naḥ samayaḥ saumya praviśa tvaṃ svam ālayam
analyzed: eṣa naḥ samayaḥ saumya praviśa tvam svam ālayam
translated: O gentle one, this is our time. Enter your own abode.

original: abhiṣiñcasva rājye ca suhṛdaḥ saṃpraharṣaya
analyzed: abhiṣiñcasva rājye ca suhṛdaḥ saṃpraharṣaya
translated: consecrate yourself in the kingdom and delight your friends.

original: iti rāmābhyanujñātaḥ sugrīvo vānararṣabhaḥ
analyzed: iti rāma abhyanujñātaḥ sugrīvaḥ vānara ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: Thus permitted by Rama, Sugriva, the bull among monkeys,

analyzed: praviveśa purīm ramyām kiṣkindhām vāli pālitām  tam vānara sahasrāṇi praviṣṭam vānara īśvaram
translated: entered the beautiful city of Kishkindha, ruled by Vali.🔽The monkey king, who had entered,

original: abhivādya prahṛṣṭāni sarvataḥ paryavārayan
analyzed: abhivādya prahṛṣṭāni sarvatas paryavārayan
translated: was surrounded on all sides by delighted thousands of monkeys.

original: tataḥ prakṛtayaḥ sarvā dṛṣṭvā harigaṇeśvaram
analyzed: tatas prakṛtayaḥ sarvāḥ dṛṣṭvā hari gaṇa īśvaram
translated: Then all the subjects, seeing the lord of the monkey hordes,

original: praṇamya mūrdhnā patitā vasudhāyāṃ samāhitāḥ
analyzed: praṇamya mūrdhnā patitāḥ vasudhāyām samāhitāḥ
translated: bowed their heads and fell to the ground in concentration.

original: sugrīvaḥ prakṛtīḥ sarvāḥ saṃbhāṣyotthāpya vīryavān
analyzed: sugrīvaḥ prakṛtīḥ sarvāḥ saṃbhāṣya utthāpya vīryavān
translated: The powerful Sugriva, having addressed all the subjects and raised them up,

original: bhrātur antaḥpuraṃ saumyaṃ praviveśa mahābalaḥ🔽praviśya tv abhiniṣkrāntaṃ sugrīvaṃ vānararṣabham
analyzed: bhrātuḥ antaḥpuram saumyam praviveśa mahā balaḥ  praviśya tu abhiniṣkrāntam sugrīvam vānara ṛṣabham
translated: entered the gentle inner quarters of his brother, the mighty one.🔽Having entered, the friends consecrated Sugriva, the bull among monkeys,

original: abhyaṣiñcanta suhṛdaḥ sahasrākṣam ivāmarāḥ🔽tasya pāṇḍuram ājahruś chatraṃ hemapariṣkṛtam
analyzed: abhyaṣiñcanta suhṛdaḥ sahasrākṣam iva amarāḥ  tasya pāṇḍuram ājahruḥ chatram hema pariṣkṛtam
translated: who had come out, like the immortals consecrating Indra.🔽They brought a white umbrella adorned with gold

original: śukle ca bālavyajane hemadaṇḍe yaśaskare
analyzed: śukle ca bāla vyajane hema daṇḍe yaśaskare
translated: and two white yak-tail fans with golden handles, which bring fame.

analyzed: tathā sarvāṇi ratnāni sarva bīja auṣadhāni ca
translated: Similarly, all the jewels, all the seeds and herbs,

translated: and the sprouts and flowers of the trees with milky sap,

analyzed: śuklāni ca eva vastrāṇi śvetam ca eva anulepanam
translated: And white garments, and white unguents,

original: sugandhīni ca mālyāni sthalajāny ambujāni ca
analyzed: sugandhīni ca mālyāni sthala jāni ambu jāni ca
translated: And fragrant garlands, and land-born lotuses,

analyzed: candanāni ca divyāni gandhān ca vividhān bahūn  akṣatam jātarūpam ca priyaṅgu madhu sarpiṣī
translated: And divine sandalwood, and many kinds of perfumes,🔽And unbroken rice, and gold, and priyangu, honey, and ghee,

analyzed: dadhi carma ca vaiyāghram vārāhī ca api upānahau
translated: And a cow's hide, and a tiger skin, and a boar's hide for shoes,

original: samālambhanam ādāya rocanāṃ samanaḥśilām
analyzed: samālambhanam ādāya rocanām samanaḥśilām
translated: Taking the samalambhana, roचना, and samanashīlā,

analyzed: ājagmuḥ tatra muditāḥ varāḥ kanyāḥ tu ṣoḍaśa
translated: The sixteen excellent maidens joyfully came there.

original: tatas te vānaraśreṣṭhaṃ yathākālaṃ yathāvidhi
analyzed: tatas te vānara śreṣṭham yathākālam yathāvidhi
translated: Then they, at the proper time and according to the rules,

analyzed: tatas kuśa paristīrṇam samiddham jātavedasam

analyzed: prāc mukham mantraiḥ sthāpayitvā varāsane
translated: Having properly installed the excellent seat facing east

analyzed: nadīnadebhyaḥ saṃhṛtya tīrthebhyaḥ ca samantataḥ
translated: Having collected from rivers, lakes, and holy places all around,

analyzed: āhṛtya ca samudrebhyaḥ sarvebhyaḥ vānara ṛṣabhāḥ

analyzed: apaḥ kanaka kumbheṣu nidhāya vimalāḥ śubhāḥ
translated: the bulls among monkeys placed the pure, auspicious water

original: śubhair vṛṣabhaśṛṅgaiś ca kalaśaiś cāpi kāñcanaiḥ
analyzed: śubhaiḥ vṛṣabha śṛṅgaiḥ ca kalaśaiḥ ca api kāñcanaiḥ

analyzed: śāstra dṛṣṭena vidhinā mahā ṛṣi vihitena ca
translated: in accordance with the method seen in the scriptures and prescribed by the great sages,

analyzed: gajaḥ gavākṣaḥ gavayaḥ śarabhaḥ gandhamādanaḥ
translated: Gaja, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sharabha, Gandhamadana,

original: maindaś ca dvividaś caiva hanūmāñ jāmbavān nalaḥ
analyzed: maindaḥ ca dvividaḥ ca eva hanumān jāmbavān nalaḥ
translated: Mainda, Dvivida, Hanuman, Jambavan, Nala,

original: abhyaṣiñcanta sugrīvaṃ prasannena sugandhinā
analyzed: abhyaṣiñcanta sugrīvam prasannena sugandhinā
translated: sprinkled Sugriva with auspicious, fragrant

original: salilena sahasrākṣaṃ vasavo vāsavaṃ yathā
analyzed: salilena sahasra akṣam vasavaḥ vāsavam yathā
translated: water, like the Vasus sprinkling Indra with water.

analyzed: abhiṣikte tu sugrīve sarve vānara puṃgavāḥ

original: rāmasya tu vacaḥ kurvan sugrīvo haripuṃgavaḥ
analyzed: rāmasya tu vacaḥ kurvan sugrīvaḥ hari puṃgavaḥ
translated: But Sugriva, the bull among monkeys, acting on Rama's words,

analyzed: aṅgadam saṃpariṣvajya yauvarājye bhiṣecayat

original: aṅgade cābhiṣikte tu sānukrośāḥ plavaṃgamāḥ
analyzed: aṅgade ca abhiṣikte tu sa anukrośāḥ plavaṃgamāḥ
translated: And when Angada was consecrated, the compassionate monkeys,

analyzed: sādhu sādhu iti sugrīvam mahātmānaḥ bhyapūjayan
translated: the great souls, praised Sugriva, saying, Excellent! Excellent!

original: hṛṣṭapuṣṭajanākīrṇā patākādhvajaśobhitā
analyzed: hṛṣṭa puṣṭa jana ākīrṇā patākā dhvaja śobhitā
translated: Crowded with joyful, well-fed people, adorned with flags and banners,

original: babhūva nagarī ramyā kṣikindhā girigahvare
analyzed: babhūva nagarī ramyā kṣikindhā giri gahvare
translated: There was a beautiful city named Kishkindha in the cave of a mountain

original: nivedya rāmāya tadā mahātmane /
analyzed: nivedya rāmāya tadā mahātmane
translated: Having offered it to the great Rama,

original: mahābhiṣekaṃ kapivāhinīpatiḥ
analyzed: mahā abhiṣekam kapi vāhinīpatiḥ
translated: The lord of the monkey army,

original: rumāṃ ca bhāryāṃ pratilabhya vīryavān /
analyzed: rumām ca bhāryām pratilabhya vīryavān
translated: The valiant one, having obtained his wife Ruma,

original: avāpa rājyaṃ tridaśādhipo yathā
analyzed: avāpa rājyam tridaśādhipaḥ yathā
translated: Obtained the kingdom like the lord of the thirty gods.

original: abhiṣikte tu sugrīve praviṣṭe vānare guhām
analyzed: abhiṣikte tu sugrīve praviṣṭe vānare guhām
translated: But when Sugriva was consecrated and the monkey entered the cave,

original: ājagāma saha bhrātrā rāmaḥ prasravaṇaṃ girim🔽śārdūlamṛgasaṃghuṣṭaṃ siṃhair bhīmaravair vṛtam🔽nānāgulmalatāgūḍhaṃ bahupādapasaṃkulam
analyzed: ājagāma saha bhrātrā rāmaḥ prasravaṇam girim  śārdūla mṛga saṃghuṣṭam siṃhaiḥ bhīma ravaiḥ vṛtam  nānā gulma latā gūḍham bahu pādapa saṃkulam
translated: Rama came with his brother to Prasravana mountain.🔽Resounding with herds of tigers and deer, surrounded by lions with terrible roars,🔽Concealed by various shrubs and creepers, full of many trees,

original: ṛkṣavānaragopucchair mārjāraiś ca niṣevitam
analyzed: ṛkṣa vānara gopucchaiḥ mārjāraiḥ ca niṣevitam
translated: frequented by bears, monkeys, mongooses and cats,

original: megharāśinibhaṃ śailaṃ nityaṃ śucijalāśrayam
analyzed: megha rāśi nibham śailam nityam śuci jala āśrayam
translated: A mountain resembling a mass of clouds, always with pure water sources,

original: tasya śailasya śikhare mahatīm āyatāṃ guhām
analyzed: tasya śailasya śikhare mahatīm āyatām guhām
translated: On the peak of that mountain, a great and large cave,

original: pratyagṛhṇata vāsārthaṃ rāmaḥ saumitriṇā saha
analyzed: pratyagṛhṇata vāsa artham rāmaḥ saumitriṇā saha
translated: Rama, along with Lakshmana, accepted it as a dwelling.

original: avasat tatra dharmātmā rāghavaḥ sahalakṣmaṇaḥ🔽bahudṛśyadarīkuñje tasmin prasravaṇe girau
analyzed: avasat tatra dharma ātmā rāghavaḥ sahalakṣmaṇaḥ  bahu dṛśya darī kuñje tasmin prasravaṇe girau
translated: The righteous Raghava, along with Lakshmana, dwelt there,🔽In that waterfall mountain, with many visible caves and groves,

original: susukhe 'pi bahudravye tasmin hi dharaṇīdhare
analyzed: su sukhe bahu dravye tasmin hi dharaṇīdhare
translated: On that very comfortable and prosperous mountain,

original: vasatas tasya rāmasya ratir alpāpi nābhavat
analyzed: vasataḥ tasya rāmasya ratiḥ alpā api nā abhavat
translated: While Rama was living there, he had not even a little joy,

original: hṛtāṃ hi bhāryāṃ smarataḥ prāṇebhyo 'pi garīyasīm
analyzed: hṛtām hi bhāryām smarataḥ prāṇebhyaḥ pi garīyasīm
translated: for he remembered his wife who had been abducted, whom he valued more than his own life.

original: udayābhyuditaṃ dṛṣṭvā śaśāṅkaṃ ca viśeṣataḥ
analyzed: udaya abhyuditam dṛṣṭvā śaśāṅkam ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: And especially when he saw the moon rising and setting,

original: āviveśa na taṃ nidrā niśāsu śayanaṃ gatam
analyzed: āviveśa na tam nidrā niśāsu śayanam gatam
translated: he did not find sleep while lying down at night.

original: tat samutthena śokena bāṣpopahatacetasaṃ
analyzed: tat samutthena śokena bāṣpa upahata cetasam
translated: With grief arising from that, his mind was overwhelmed by tears,

original: taṃ śocamānaṃ kākutsthaṃ nityaṃ śokaparāyaṇam
analyzed: tam śocamānam kākutstham nityam śoka parāyaṇam
translated: and Kakutstha, grieving, was always devoted to sorrow.

original: tulyaduḥkho 'bravīd bhrātā lakṣmaṇo 'nunayan vacaḥ
analyzed: tulya duḥkhaḥ bravīt bhrātā lakṣmaṇaḥ nunayan vacaḥ
translated: His brother Lakshmana, who shared his grief, spoke to him in a conciliatory voice:

original: alaṃ vīra vyathāṃ gatvā na tvaṃ śocitum arhasi
analyzed: alam vīra vyathām gatvā na tvam śocitum arhasi
translated: Enough, O hero, of being distressed; you should not grieve.

original: śocato hy avasīdanti sarvārthā viditaṃ hi te
analyzed: śocataḥ hi avasīdanti sarva arthāḥ viditam hi te
translated: For when one grieves, all goals are lost, as you know.

original: bhavān kriyāparo loke bhavān devaparāyaṇaḥ
analyzed: bhavān kriyā paraḥ loke bhavān deva parāyaṇaḥ
translated: You are devoted to ritual in the world, you are devoted to the gods,

original: āstiko dharmaśīlaś ca vyavasāyī ca rāghava🔽na hy avyavasitaḥ śatruṃ rākṣasaṃ taṃ viśeṣataḥ
analyzed: āstikaḥ dharma śīlaḥ ca vyavasāyī ca rāghava  na hi a vyavasitaḥ śatrum rākṣasam tam viśeṣataḥ
translated: you are a believer, of righteous conduct, and resolute, O Raghava.🔽For you are not able to kill that enemy, that demon, especially that crooked one,

original: samarthas tvaṃ raṇe hantuṃ vikramair jihmakāriṇam
analyzed: samarthaḥ tvam raṇe hantum vikramaiḥ jihma kāriṇam
translated: without being resolute, with your prowess in battle.

original: samunmūlaya śokaṃ tvaṃ vyavasāyaṃ sthiraṃ kuru
analyzed: samunmūlaya śokam tvam vyavasāyam sthiram kuru
translated: Uproot your sorrow, make your resolve firm,

original: tataḥ saparivāraṃ taṃ nirmūlaṃ kuru rākṣasaṃ
analyzed: tatas sa parivāram tam nirmūlam kuru rākṣasam
translated: and then destroy that demon along with his retinue.

original: pṛthivīm api kākutstha sasāgaravanācalām
analyzed: pṛthivīm api kākutstha sa sāgara vana acalām
translated: O Kakutstha, you are able to overturn the earth with its oceans, forests and mountains,

original: parivartayituṃ śaktaḥ kim aṅga puna rāvaṇam
analyzed: parivartayitum śaktaḥ kim aṅga punar rāvaṇam
translated: what to speak of Ravana?

original: ahaṃ tu khalu te vīryaṃ prasuptaṃ pratibodhaye
analyzed: aham tu khalu te vīryam prasuptam pratibodhaye
translated: But I shall indeed awaken your sleeping valor,

original: dīptair āhutibhiḥ kāle bhasmac channam ivānalam
analyzed: dīptaiḥ āhutibhiḥ kāle bhasma channam iva analam
translated: like kindling a fire hidden in ashes with blazing oblations at the right time.

original: lakṣmaṇasya tu tad vākyaṃ pratipūjya hitaṃ śubham
analyzed: lakṣmaṇasya tu tat vākyam pratipūjya hitam śubham
translated: Having honored the beneficial and auspicious words of Lakshmana,

original: rāghavaḥ suhṛdaṃ snigdham idaṃ vacanam abravīt
analyzed: rāghavaḥ suhṛdam snigdham idam vacanam abravīt
translated: Raghava spoke these words to his affectionate and friendly brother:

original: vācyaṃ yad anuraktena snigdhena ca hitena ca
analyzed: vācyam yat anuraktena snigdhena ca hitena ca
translated: What should be said by a devoted, affectionate and beneficial person,

original: satyavikrama yuktena tad uktaṃ lakṣmaṇa tvayā
analyzed: satya vikrama yuktena tat uktam lakṣmaṇa tvayā
translated: endowed with truth and valor, has been spoken by you, Lakshmana.

original: eṣa śokaḥ parityaktaḥ sarvakāryāvasādakaḥ
analyzed: eṣa śokaḥ parityaktaḥ sarva kārya avasādakaḥ
translated: This grief, which causes the failure of all actions, has been abandoned by me.

original: vikrameṣv apratihataṃ tejaḥ protsāhayāmy aham
analyzed: vikrameṣu apratihatam tejaḥ protsāhayāmi aham
translated: I encourage my unhindered valor in undertakings.

original: śaratkālaṃ pratīkṣe 'ham iyaṃ prāvṛḍ upasthitā
analyzed: śarad kālam pratīkṣe ham iyam prāvṛṣ upasthitā
translated: I am waiting for the autumn season, this rainy season has arrived.

original: tataḥ sarāṣṭraṃ sagaṇaṃ rākṣasaṃ taṃ nihanmy aham
analyzed: tatas sa rāṣṭram sa gaṇam rākṣasam tam nihanmi aham
translated: Then I will kill that demon, along with his kingdom and followers.

original: tasya tadvacanaṃ śrutvā hṛṣṭo rāmasya lakṣmaṇaḥ
analyzed: tasya tat vacanam śrutvā hṛṣṭaḥ rāmasya lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Having heard those words of Rama, Lakshmana was delighted,

original: punar evābravīd vākyaṃ saumitrir mitranandanaḥ
analyzed: punar eva abravīt vākyam saumitriḥ mitra nandanaḥ
translated: and again Saumitri, the delighter of friends, spoke these words:

original: etat te sadṛśaṃ vākyam uktaṃ śatrunibarhaṇa
analyzed: etat te sadṛśam vākyam uktam śatru nibarhaṇa
translated: O destroyer of enemies, these words spoken by you are befitting you,

original: idānīm asi kākutstha prakṛtiṃ svām upāgataḥ
analyzed: idānīm asi kākutstha prakṛtim svām upāgataḥ
translated: Now, O Kakutstha, you have attained your natural state.

original: vijñāya hy ātmano vīryaṃ tathyaṃ bhavitum arhasi
analyzed: vijñāya hi ātmanaḥ vīryam tathyam bhavitum arhasi
translated: Having understood your own prowess, you should be truthful.

original: etat sadṛśam uktaṃ te śrutasyābhijanasya ca
analyzed: etat sadṛśam uktam te śrutasya abhijanasya ca
translated: This is befitting of what has been said by you, of what has been heard, and of your lineage.

original: tasmāt puruṣaśārdūla cintayañ śatrunigraham
analyzed: tasmāt puruṣa śārdūla cintayam śatru nigraham
translated: Therefore, O tiger among men, thinking of the subjugation of your enemy,

original: varṣārātram anuprāptam atikrāmaya rāghava
analyzed: varṣārātram anuprāptam atikrāmaya rāghava
translated: let the rainy season pass, O Raghava.

original: niyamya kopaṃ pratipālyatāṃ śarat /
analyzed: niyamya kopam pratipālyatām śarad
translated: Controlling your anger, wait for the autumn.

original: kṣamasva māsāṃś caturo mayā saha
analyzed: kṣamasva māsān caturaḥ mayā saha
translated: Forgive me and stay with me for four months

original: vasācale 'smin mṛgarājasevite /
analyzed: vasa acale smin mṛgarāja sevite
translated: in this mountain frequented by lion-kings.

original: saṃvardhayañ śatruvadhe samudyataḥ
analyzed: saṃvardhayam śatru vadhe samudyataḥ
translated: Nurturing yourself, ready to kill your enemy.

original: sa tadā vālinaṃ hatvā sugrīvam abhiṣicya ca
analyzed: sa tadā vālinam hatvā sugrīvam abhiṣicya ca
translated: Having killed Vali and consecrated Sugriva,

original: vasan mālyavataḥ pṛṣṭe rāmo lakṣmaṇam abravīt
analyzed: vasan mālyavataḥ pṛṣṭe rāmaḥ lakṣmaṇam abravīt
translated: Rama, dwelling on the slope of Malyavan, said to Lakshmana:

original: ayaṃ sa kālaḥ saṃprāptaḥ samayo 'dya jalāgamaḥ
analyzed: ayam sa kālaḥ saṃprāptaḥ samayaḥ jalāgamaḥ
translated: This is the time that has come, the season for rain today.

original: saṃpaśya tvaṃ nabho meghaiḥ saṃvṛtaṃ girisaṃnibhaiḥ
analyzed: saṃpaśya tvam nabhaḥ meghaiḥ saṃvṛtam giri saṃnibhaiḥ
translated: See the sky covered with clouds resembling mountains.

original: nava māsa dhṛtaṃ garbhaṃ bhāskārasya gabhastibhiḥ
analyzed: nava māsa dhṛtam garbham bhāskārasya gabhastibhiḥ
translated: The embryo held for nine months by the rays of the sun,

original: pītvā rasaṃ samudrāṇāṃ dyauḥ prasūte rasāyanam
analyzed: pītvā rasam samudrāṇām dyauḥ prasūte rasāyanam
translated: having drunk the essence of the oceans, the sky gives birth to nectar.

original: śakyam ambaram āruhya meghasopānapaṅktibhiḥ
analyzed: śakyam ambaram āruhya megha sopāna paṅktibhiḥ
translated: It is possible to ascend the sky with the rows of stairs formed by the clouds.

original: kuṭajārjunamālābhir alaṃkartuṃ divākaram
analyzed: kuṭaja arjuna mālābhiḥ alaṃkartum divākaram
translated: As if to adorn the sun with garlands of kutaja and arjuna flowers,

original: saṃdhyārāgotthitais tāmrair anteṣv adhikapāṇḍuraiḥ🔽snigdhair abhrapaṭacchadair baddhavraṇam ivāmbaram🔽mandamārutaniḥśvāsaṃ saṃdhyācandanarañjitam
analyzed: saṃdhyā rāga utthitaiḥ tāmraiḥ anteṣu adhika pāṇḍuraiḥ  snigdhaiḥ abhra paṭa chadaiḥ baddha vraṇam iva ambaram
translated: The ends of the sky, reddened by the glow of evening, are more white than usual,🔽And the sky, with its smooth cloud-like patches, seems to have its wounds bound up.🔽With gentle breezes for its sighs, and the evening sandalwood paste for its color,

original: āpāṇḍujaladaṃ bhāti kāmāturam ivāmbaram
analyzed: āpāṇḍu jaladam bhāti kāma āturam iva ambaram
translated: The sky, with its pale clouds, appears like a lovesick man.

original: eṣā dharmaparikliṣṭā navavāripariplutā
analyzed: eṣā dharma parikliṣṭā nava vāri pariplutā
translated: This earth, afflicted by righteousness and flooded with fresh water,

original: sīteva śokasaṃtaptā mahī bāṣpaṃ vimuñcati🔽meghodaravinirmuktāḥ kahlārasukhaśītalāḥ
analyzed: sītā iva śoka saṃtaptā mahī bāṣpam vimuñcati
translated: Like Sita tormented by grief, sheds tears.🔽The winds, released from the interiors of clouds, are pleasant and cool like lotus fibers,

original: śakyam añjalibhiḥ pātuṃ vātāḥ ketakigandhinaḥ
analyzed: śakyam añjalibhiḥ pātum vātāḥ ketaki gandhinaḥ
translated: And can be drunk with cupped hands, fragrant with ketaki flowers.

original: eṣa phullārjunaḥ śailaḥ ketakair adhivāsitaḥ
analyzed: eṣa phulla arjunaḥ śailaḥ ketakaiḥ adhivāsitaḥ
translated: This mountain, with its blossoming arjuna trees and inhabited by ketaki flowers,

original: sugrīva iva śāntārir dhārābhir abhiṣicyate
analyzed: sugrīvaḥ iva śānta ariḥ dhārābhiḥ abhiṣicyate
translated: Is consecrated with streams, like Sugriva, the enemy of Vali.

original: meghakṛṣṇājinadharā dhārāyajñopavītinaḥ
analyzed: megha kṛṣṇa ajina dharāḥ dhārā yajña upavītinaḥ
translated: Clad in the black antelope skin of clouds, wearing the sacred thread of rain,

original: mārutāpūritaguhāḥ prādhītā iva parvatāḥ
analyzed: māruta āpūrita guhāḥ prādhītāḥ iva parvatāḥ
translated: And with their caves filled with wind, the mountains seem to have studied.

original: kaśābhir iva haimībhir vidyudbhir iva tāḍitam
analyzed: kaśābhiḥ iva haimībhiḥ vidyudbhiḥ iva tāḍitam
translated: Struck by golden whips, as it were, by lightning bolts,

original: antaḥstanitanirghoṣaṃ savedanam ivāmbaram
analyzed: antar stanita nirghoṣam sa vedanam iva ambaram
translated: The sky, with the rumbling of thunder within, seems to be in pain.

original: nīlameghāśritā vidyut sphurantī pratibhāti me
analyzed: nīla megha āśritā vidyut sphurantī pratibhāti me
translated: The lightning, resting on the blue clouds, shines forth to me,

original: sphurantī rāvaṇasyāṅke vaidehīva tapasvinī
analyzed: sphurantī rāvaṇasya aṅke vaidehī iva tapasvinī
translated: Shining on Ravana's lap like the ascetic Vaidehi.

original: imās tā manmathavatāṃ hitāḥ pratihatā diśaḥ
analyzed: imāḥ tāḥ manmathavatām hitāḥ pratihatāḥ diśaḥ
translated: These are the directions, struck down, which are beneficial to those who are passionate,

original: anuliptā iva ghanair naṣṭagrahaniśākarāḥ🔽kva cid bāṣpābhisaṃruddhān varṣāgamasamutsukān
analyzed: anuliptāḥ iva ghanaiḥ naṣṭa graha niśākarāḥ  kva cit bāṣpa abhisaṃruddhān varṣāgama samutsukān
translated: As if smeared with clouds, with the planets and moon destroyed.🔽In some places, the Kutaja trees are seen, O son of Sumitra, nourished on the mountain slopes,

original: kuṭajān paśya saumitre puṣṭitān girisānuṣu
analyzed: kuṭajān paśya saumitre puṣṭitān giri sānuṣu
translated: Filled with smoke from the funeral pyres of the wives of travelers,

original: mama śokābhibhūtasya kāmasaṃdīpanān sthitān🔽rajaḥ praśāntaṃ sahimo 'dya vāyur /🔽nidāghadoṣaprasarāḥ praśāntāḥ
analyzed: mama śoka abhibhūtasya kāma saṃdīpanān sthitān  rajaḥ praśāntam sahimaḥ vāyuḥ  nidāgha doṣa prasarāḥ praśāntāḥ
translated: Overwhelmed by my grief, standing like kindlers of passion.🔽The dust has settled, the wind is now with frost,🔽The spread of the faults of summer are pacified,

original: sthitā hi yātrā vasudhādhipānāṃ /
analyzed: sthitā hi yātrā vasudhā adhipānām
translated: The journeys of the lords of the earth are halted,

original: pravāsino yānti narāḥ svadeśān
analyzed: pravāsinaḥ yānti narāḥ sva deśān
translated: Men who are in exile go to their own countries,

original: saṃprasthitā mānasavāsalubdhāḥ /
analyzed: saṃprasthitāḥ mānasa vāsa lubdhāḥ
translated: Departing, greedy for dwelling in the mind,

original: priyānvitāḥ saṃprati cakravākaḥ
analyzed: priya anvitāḥ saṃprati cakravākaḥ
translated: The ruddy geese, along with their beloveds,

original: abhīkṣṇavarṣodakavikṣateṣu /
analyzed: abhīkṣṇa varṣa udaka vikṣateṣu
translated: In places where the rain has damaged the water,

original: yānāni mārgeṣu na saṃpatanti
analyzed: yānāni mārgeṣu na saṃpatanti
translated: The vehicles do not descend on the roads.

original: kva cit prakāśaṃ kva cid aprakāśaṃ /
analyzed: kva cit prakāśam kva cit aprakāśam
translated: In some places it is bright, in some places it is not,

original: nabhaḥ prakīrṇāmbudharaṃ vibhāti
analyzed: nabhaḥ prakīrṇa ambudharam vibhāti
translated: The sky shines with scattered rain clouds,

original: kva cit kva cit parvatasaṃniruddhaṃ /
analyzed: kva cit kva cit parvata saṃniruddham
translated: In some places obstructed by mountains,

original: rūpaṃ yathā śāntamahārṇavasya
analyzed: rūpam yathā śānta mahā arṇavasya
translated: The form of the calm great ocean,

original: vyāmiśritaṃ sarjakadambapuṣpair /
analyzed: vyāmiśritam sarja kadamba puṣpaiḥ
translated: Mixed with the flowers of the Sarja and Kadamba trees,

original: navaṃ jalaṃ parvatadhātutāmram
analyzed: navam jalam parvata dhātu tāmram
translated: The fresh water, copper-colored with mountain minerals,

original: mayūrakekābhir anuprayātaṃ /
analyzed: mayūra kekābhiḥ anuprayātam
translated: Followed by the cries of peacocks,

original: śailāpagāḥ śīghrataraṃ vahanti🔽rasākulaṃ ṣaṭpadasaṃnikāśaṃ /
analyzed: śaila āpagāḥ śīghrataram vahanti  rasa ākulam ṣaṭpada saṃnikāśam
translated: The mountain streams flow even faster,🔽Filled with sap, resembling bees.

original: prabhujyate jambuphalaṃ prakāmam
analyzed: prabhujyate jambu phalam prakāmam
translated: The rose-apple fruit is enjoyed to one's heart's content,

original: anekavarṇaṃ pavanāvadhūtaṃ /
analyzed: aneka varṇam pavana avadhūtam
translated: Blown by the wind, of many colors.

original: bhūmau pataty āmraphalaṃ vipakvam🔽vidyutpatākāḥ sabalāka mālāḥ /
analyzed: bhūmau patati āmra phalam vipakvam  vidyutpatākāḥ sabalāka mālāḥ
translated: The ripe mango fruit falls on the ground,🔽With lightning as its banner, a garland of cranes.

original: śailendrakūṭākṛtisaṃnikāśāḥ
analyzed: śailendra kūṭa ākṛti saṃnikāśāḥ
translated: Resembling the peaks of the king of mountains,

original: garjanti meghāḥ samudīrṇanādā /
analyzed: garjanti meghāḥ samudīrṇa nādā
translated: The clouds roar with loud sounds,

original: mattagajendrā iva saṃyugasthaḥ🔽meghābhikāmī parisaṃpatantī /
analyzed: matta gaja indrāḥ iva saṃyuga sthaḥ  megha abhikāmī parisaṃpatantī
translated: Like proud lordly elephants in battle,🔽The clouds, eager for love, fly around,

original: saṃmoditā bhāti balākapaṅktiḥ🔽vātāvadhūtā varapauṇḍarīkī /
analyzed: saṃmoditā bhāti balāka paṅktiḥ  vātāvadhūtā varapauṇḍarīkī
translated: The row of cranes, delighted, shines,🔽Like a garland of white lotuses blown by the wind,

original: lambeva mālā racitāmbarasya
analyzed: lambā iva mālā racitā ambarasya
translated: Hanging like a garland on the sky,

original: nidrā śanaiḥ keśavam abhyupaiti /
analyzed: nidrā śanais keśavam abhyupaiti
translated: Sleep slowly approaches Keshava.

original: drutaṃ nadī sāgaram abhyupaiti🔽hṛṣṭā balākā ghanam abhyupaiti /🔽kāntā sakāmā priyam abhyupaiti
analyzed: drutam nadī sāgaram abhyupaiti  hṛṣṭā balākā ghanam abhyupaiti  kāntā sa kāmā priyam abhyupaiti
translated: The river quickly approaches the ocean,🔽The delighted crane approaches the cloud,🔽The passionate beloved approaches her lover,

original: jātā vanāntāḥ śikhisupranṛttā /
analyzed: jātāḥ vana antāḥ śikhi su pranṛttā
translated: The forest ends, with the excellent dancing of peacocks,

original: jātāḥ kadambāḥ sakadambaśākhāḥ🔽jātā vṛṣā goṣu samānakāmā /
analyzed: jātāḥ kadambāḥ sa kadamba śākhāḥ  jātā vṛṣā goṣu samāna kāmā
translated: The kadamba trees with kadamba branches have sprouted,🔽The bulls have become equal in desire with the cows,

original: jātā mahī sasyavanābhirāmā
analyzed: jātā mahī sasya vana abhirāmā
translated: The earth has become delightful with crops and forests.

original: vahanti varṣanti nadanti bhānti /
analyzed: vahanti varṣanti nadanti bhānti
translated: They carry, rain, roar, shine,

original: dhyāyanti nṛtyanti samāśvasanti🔽nadyo ghanā mattagajā vanāntāḥ /
analyzed: dhyāyanti nṛtyanti samāśvasanti  nadyaḥ ghanāḥ matta gajāḥ vana antāḥ
translated: Meditate, dance, and breathe deeply.🔽Rivers, clouds, intoxicated elephants, forest ends,

original: priyāvinīhāḥ śikhinaḥ plavaṃgāḥ
analyzed: priyā vinīhāḥ śikhinaḥ plavaṃgāḥ
translated: The amorous activities of beloveds, peacocks, monkeys,

original: praharṣitāḥ ketakapuṣpagandham /
analyzed: praharṣitāḥ ketaka puṣpa gandham
translated: Delighted, smelling the fragrance of ketaka flowers,

original: āghrāya hṛṣṭā vananirjhareṣu
analyzed: āghrāya hṛṣṭāḥ vana nirjhareṣu
translated: Rejoicing in the mountain streams,

original: prapāta śabdākulitā gajendrāḥ /
analyzed: prapāta śabda ākulitāḥ gajendrāḥ
translated: The great elephants, agitated by the sounds of waterfalls,

original: sārdhaṃ mayūraiḥ samadā nadanti🔽dhārānipātair abhihanyamānāḥ /
analyzed: sārdham mayūraiḥ samadāḥ nadanti  dhārā nipātaiḥ abhihanyamānāḥ
translated: Roar together with peacocks.🔽Struck by the falling rain,

original: kadambaśākhāsu vilambamānāḥ🔽kṣaṇārjitaṃ puṣparasāvagāḍhaṃ /
analyzed: kadamba śākhāsu vilambamānāḥ  kṣaṇa arjitam puṣpa rasa avagāḍham
translated: The bees, clinging to the kadamba branches,

original: śanair madaṃ ṣaṭcaraṇās tyajanti🔽aṅgāracūrṇotkarasaṃnikāśaiḥ /
analyzed: śanais madam ṣaṣ caraṇāḥ tyajanti  aṅgāra cūrṇa utkara saṃnikāśaiḥ
translated: Slowly give up their intoxication, deeply immersed in the nectar of the flowers earned in an instant.

original: phalaiḥ suparyāpta rasaiḥ samṛddhaiḥ🔽jambūdrumāṇāṃ pravibhānti śākhā /
analyzed: phalaiḥ suparyāpta rasaiḥ samṛddhaiḥ  jambu drumāṇām pravibhānti śākhāḥ
translated: The branches of the rose-apple trees shine with fruits that are fully ripe and rich in juice,

original: nilīyamānā iva ṣaṭpadaughaiḥ🔽taḍitpatākābhir alaṃkṛtānām /🔽udīrṇagambhīramahāravāṇām🔽vibhānti rūpāṇi balāhakānāṃ /
analyzed: nilīyamānāḥ iva ṣaṭpada oghaiḥ  taḍit patākābhiḥ alaṃkṛtānām  udīrṇa gambhīra mahā ravāṇām  vibhānti rūpāṇi balāhakānām
translated: Looking as if they are covered with swarms of bees.🔽The forms of the clouds, adorned with lightning banners,🔽Resound with deep and loud roars, shining like

original: raṇodyatānām iva vāraṇānām
analyzed: raṇa udyatānām iva vāraṇānām
translated: Elephants ready for battle.

original: mārgānugaḥ śailavanānusārī /
translated: Following the path, accompanied by the mountains and forests,

original: saṃprasthito megharavaṃ niśamya
analyzed: saṃprasthitaḥ megha ravam niśamya
translated: Setting out, hearing the thunder,

original: yuddhābhikāmaḥ pratināgaśaṅkī /
analyzed: yuddha abhikāmaḥ pratināga śaṅkī
translated: Desiring battle, suspecting an opposing elephant,

original: matto gajendraḥ pratisaṃnivṛttaḥ🔽muktāsakāśaṃ salilaṃ patad vai /
analyzed: mattaḥ gaja indraḥ pratisaṃnivṛttaḥ  muktā sakāśam salilam patat vai
translated: The intoxicated lord of elephants turned back,🔽The water falling near the pearls, stuck in the leaf cups,

original: sunirmalaṃ patrapuṭeṣu lagnam
analyzed: su nirmalam patra puṭeṣu lagnam
translated: Was very clear,

original: hṛṣṭā vivarṇacchadanā vihaṃgāḥ /
analyzed: hṛṣṭāḥ vivarṇa chadanāḥ vihaṃgāḥ
translated: The birds, with their wings delighted and colorful,

original: surendradattaṃ tṛṣitāḥ pibanti
analyzed: sura indra dattam tṛṣitāḥ pibanti
translated: Thirsty, drank the water given by Indra of the gods.

original: nīleṣu nīlā navavāripūrṇā /🔽megheṣu meghāḥ pravibhānti saktāḥ🔽davāgnidagdheṣu davāgnidagdhāḥ /
analyzed: nīleṣu nīlā nava vāri pūrṇā  megheṣu meghāḥ pravibhānti saktāḥ  dava agni dagdheṣu dava agni dagdhāḥ
translated: The new clouds filled with water shine in the blue clouds,🔽The clouds burnt by forest fire shine in the clouds burnt by forest fire,

original: śaileṣu śailā iva baddhamūlāḥ
analyzed: śaileṣu śailāḥ iva baddha mūlāḥ
translated: The mountains with firm roots shine in the mountains.

original: mattā gajendrā muditā gavendrā /
analyzed: mattāḥ gaja indrā muditāḥ gava indrā
translated: The intoxicated lord of elephants, the delighted lord of cows,

original: vaneṣu viśrāntatarā mṛgendrāḥ
analyzed: vaneṣu viśrāntatarāḥ mṛgendrāḥ
translated: The lord of deer very relaxed in the forests,

original: ramyā nagendrā nibhṛtā nagendrāḥ /
analyzed: ramyāḥ naga indrāḥ nibhṛtāḥ naga indrāḥ
translated: The beautiful lord of mountains, the calm lord of mountains,

original: prakrīḍito vāridharaiḥ surendraḥ
analyzed: prakrīḍitaḥ vāridharaiḥ sura indraḥ
translated: Indra of the gods sported with the rain clouds.

original: vṛttā yātrā narendrāṇāṃ senā pratinivartate
analyzed: vṛttā yātrā narendrāṇām senā pratinivartate
translated: The journey of the kings was completed, the army returned,

original: vairāṇi caiva mārgāś ca salilena samīkṛtāḥ
analyzed: vairāṇi ca eva mārgāḥ ca salilena samīkṛtāḥ
translated: Enmities and paths were made equal by the water.

original: māsi prauṣṭhapade brahma brāhmaṇānāṃ vivakṣatām
analyzed: māsi prauṣṭhapade brahma brāhmaṇānām vivakṣatām
translated: In the month of Praushthapada, when the Brahmins desire to speak,

original: ayam adhyāyasamayaḥ sāmagānām upasthitaḥ
analyzed: ayam adhyāya samayaḥ sāmagānām upasthitaḥ
translated: This is the time for the chapters of the Saman singers.

original: nivṛttakarmāyatano nūnaṃ saṃcitasaṃcayaḥ
analyzed: nivṛtta karma āyatanaḥ nūnam saṃcita saṃcayaḥ
translated: The one who has turned away from the abode of action, who has accumulated the accumulated, surely

original: āṣāḍhīm abhyupagato bharataḥ koṣakādhipaḥ
analyzed: āṣāḍhīm abhyupagataḥ bharataḥ koṣaka adhipaḥ
translated: Bharata, the lord of the treasury, has arrived at the month of Ashadha.

original: nūnam āpūryamāṇāyāḥ sarayvā vadhate rayaḥ
analyzed: nūnam āpūryamāṇāyāḥ sarayvāḥ vadhate rayaḥ
translated: Surely, the wealth of the Sarayu, as it is being filled up, will be destroyed.

original: māṃ samīkṣya samāyāntam ayodhyāyā iva svanaḥ
