analyzed: siddhārthāḥ saṃnivartadhvam adhigamya ca maithilīm
translated: Having accomplished your purpose and found Maithili,

original: mahendrakāntāṃ vanaṣaṇḍa maṇḍitāṃ /
analyzed: mahā indra kāntām vana ṣaṇḍa maṇḍitām
translated: the region loved by the great Indra, adorned with groves,

original: diśaṃ caritvā nipuṇena vānarāḥ
analyzed: diśam caritvā nipuṇena vānarāḥ
translated: having roamed in that direction with skill, O monkeys,

original: avāpya sītāṃ raghuvaṃśajapriyāṃ /
analyzed: avāpya sītām raghu vaṃśa ja priyām
translated: having obtained Sita, dear to the scion of the Raghu dynasty,

original: tato nivṛttāḥ sukhito bhaviṣyatha🔽tataḥ prasthāpya sugrīvas tan mahad vānaraṃ balam
analyzed: tatas nivṛttāḥ sukhitaḥ bhaviṣyatha  tatas prasthāpya sugrīvaḥ tat mahat vānaram balam
translated: then returning, you will be happy.🔽Then, having sent forth that great army of monkeys,

original: dakṣiṇāṃ preṣayām āsa vānarān abhilakṣitān
analyzed: dakṣiṇām preṣayām āsa vānarān abhilakṣitān
translated: Sugriva dispatched the designated monkeys to the south.

original: nīlam agnisutaṃ caiva hanumantaṃ ca vānaram
analyzed: nīlam agni sutam ca eva hanumantam ca vānaram
translated: Nila, the son of Agni, and the monkey Hanuman,

original: pitāmahasutaṃ caiva jāmbavantaṃ mahākapim
analyzed: pitāmaha sutam ca eva jāmbavantam mahā kapim
translated: and the great monkey Jambavan, the grandson of the grandfather,

original: suhotraṃ ca śarīraṃ ca śaragulmaṃ tathaiva ca
analyzed: suhotram ca śarīram ca śara gulmam tathā eva ca
translated: Suhotra, Sharīra, and Sharagulma,

original: gajaṃ gavākṣaṃ gavayaṃ suṣeṇam ṛṣabhaṃ tathā
analyzed: gajam gavākṣam gavayam suṣeṇam ṛṣabham tathā
translated: Gaja, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sushena, Rishabha,

original: maindaṃ ca dvividaṃ caiva vijayaṃ gandhamādanam
analyzed: maindam ca dvividam ca eva vijayam gandhamādanam
translated: Mainda, Dvivida, Vijaya, Gandhamadana,

original: ulkāmukham asaṅgaṃ ca hutāśana sutāv ubhau
analyzed: ulkāmukham asaṅgam ca hutāśana sutau ubhau
translated: Utkāmukha, Asanga, and both the sons of Hutashana,

original: aṅgadapramukhān vīrān vīraḥ kapigaṇeśvaraḥ
analyzed: aṅgada pramukhān vīrān vīraḥ kapi gaṇa īśvaraḥ
translated: the hero, the lord of the monkey troops, sent the heroes headed by Angada,

original: vegavikramasaṃpannān saṃdideśa viśeṣavit
analyzed: vega vikrama saṃpannān saṃdideśa viśeṣa vid
translated: The one who knew the distinctions ordered them, endowed with speed and valor.

original: teṣām agreṣaraṃ caiva mahad balam asaṃgagam
analyzed: teṣām agreṣaram ca eva mahat balam asaṃgagam
translated: Having placed a great army, invincible in battle, at their head,

original: vidhāya harivīrāṇām ādiśad dakṣiṇāṃ diśam
analyzed: vidhāya hari vīrāṇām ādiśat dakṣiṇām diśam
translated: he directed them to the southern direction, the foremost heroes of the monkeys.

original: ye ke cana samuddeśās tasyāṃ diśi sudurgamāḥ
analyzed: ye ke cana samuddeśāḥ tasyām diśi su durgamāḥ
translated: Whatever regions are difficult to access in that direction,

original: kapīśaḥ kapimukhyānāṃ sa teṣāṃ tān udāharat
analyzed: kapīśaḥ kapi mukhyānām sa teṣām tān udāharat
translated: the lord of the monkeys mentioned them to the chief monkeys.

original: sahasraśirasaṃ vindhyaṃ nānādrumalatāvṛtam
analyzed: sahasra śirasam vindhyam nānā druma latā āvṛtam
translated: The Vindhya (mountain) with a thousand peaks, covered with various trees and creepers,

original: narmadāṃ ca nadīṃ durgāṃ mahoraganiṣevitām
analyzed: narmadām ca nadīm durgām mahā uraga niṣevitām
translated: and the difficult-to-access Narmada river, inhabited by great serpents,

original: tato godāvarīṃ ramyāṃ kṛṣṇāveṇīṃ mahānadīm
analyzed: tatas godāvarīm ramyām kṛṣṇāveṇīm mahā nadīm
translated: then the beautiful Godavari, the great river Krishnaveni,

original: varadāṃ ca mahābhāgāṃ mahoraganiṣevitām
analyzed: vara dām ca mahābhāgām mahā uraga niṣevitām
translated: the greatly fortunate Vara, inhabited by great serpents,

original: mekhalān utkalāṃś caiva daśārṇanagarāṇy api
analyzed: mekhalān utkalān ca eva daśārṇa nagarāṇi api
translated: the Mekhalas, Utkalas, and the cities of Dasharna,

original: avantīm abhravantīṃ ca sarvam evānupaśyata
analyzed: avantīm abhravantīm ca sarvam eva anupaśyata
translated: all of Avanti and Abhravanti,

original: vidarbhān ṛṣikāṃś caiva ramyān māhiṣakān api
analyzed: vidarbhān ṛṣikān ca eva ramyān māhiṣakān api
translated: the Vidarbhas, the Rishis, and the beautiful MahiSHakas,

original: tathā baṅgān kaliṅgāṃś ca kauśikāṃś ca samantataḥ🔽anvīkṣya daṇḍakāraṇyaṃ saparvatanadīguham
analyzed: tathā baṅgān kaliṅgān ca kauśikān ca samantataḥ  anvīkṣya daṇḍaka araṇyam sa parvata nadī guham
translated: and likewise the Bangas, Kalingas, and Koshis all around,🔽having surveyed Dandakaranya with its mountains, rivers, and caves,

original: nadīṃ godāvarīṃ caiva sarvam evānupaśyata
analyzed: nadīm godāvarīm ca eva sarvam eva anupaśyata
translated: and the Godavari river, all of it,

original: tathaivāndhrāṃś ca puṇḍrāṃś ca colān pāṇḍyān sakeralān
analyzed: tathā eva andhrān ca puṇḍrān ca colān pāṇḍyān sa keralān
translated: And the Andhras, Pundras, Cholas, Pandyas, and Keralas,

original: ayomukhaś ca gantavyaḥ parvato dhātumaṇḍitaḥ
analyzed: ayomukhaḥ ca gantavyaḥ parvataḥ dhātu maṇḍitaḥ
translated: And the mountain Aymukha, adorned with minerals,

original: vicitraśikharaḥ śrīmāṃś citrapuṣpitakānanaḥ
analyzed: vicitra śikharaḥ śrīmān citra puṣpita kānanaḥ
translated: With its variegated peaks, glorious, with colorful flowering forests,

original: sacandanavanoddeśo mārgitavyo mahāgiriḥ
analyzed: sa candana vana uddeśaḥ mārgitavyaḥ mahā giriḥ
translated: And the region of the sandalwood forest, that great mountain should be searched.

original: tatas tām āpagāṃ divyāṃ prasannasalilāṃ śivām
analyzed: tatas tām āpagām divyām prasanna salilām śivām
translated: Then that divine river with clear water, auspicious,

original: tatra drakṣyatha kāverīṃ vihṛtām apsarogaṇaiḥ🔽tasyāsīnaṃ nagasyāgre malayasya mahaujasaṃ
analyzed: tatra drakṣyatha kāverīm vihṛtām apsaraḥ gaṇaiḥ  tasya āsīnam nagasya agre malayasya mahā ojasam
translated: There you will see the Kaveri, frequented by groups of celestial nymphs.

original: drakṣyathādityasaṃkāśam agastyam ṛṣisattamam
analyzed: drakṣyatha āditya saṃkāśam agastyam ṛṣi sattamam
translated: You will see the supremely radiant sage Agastya, seated on the top of the Malaya mountain,🔽Resembling the sun, the best of sages.

original: tatas tenābhyanujñātāḥ prasannena mahātmanā
analyzed: tatas tena abhyanujñātāḥ prasannena mahātmanā
translated: Then, permitted by that pleased great soul,

original: tāmraparṇīṃ grāhajuṣṭāṃ tariṣyatha mahānadīm
analyzed: tāmraparṇīm grāha juṣṭām tariṣyatha mahā nadīm
translated: You will cross the great river Tamraparni, infested with crocodiles.

original: sā candanavanair divyaiḥ pracchannā dvīpa śālinī
analyzed: sā candana vanaiḥ divyaiḥ pracchannā dvīpa śālinī
translated: It is covered with divine sandalwood forests, with islands,

original: kānteva yuvatiḥ kāntaṃ samudram avagāhate🔽tato hemamayaṃ divyaṃ muktāmaṇivibhūṣitam
analyzed: kāntā iva yuvatiḥ kāntam samudram avagāhate  tatas hema mayam divyam muktāmaṇi vibhūṣitam
translated: Like a beautiful young woman plunging into the ocean, her beloved.

original: yuktaṃ kavāṭaṃ pāṇḍyānāṃ gatā drakṣyatha vānarāḥ
analyzed: yuktam kavāṭam pāṇḍyānām gatāḥ drakṣyatha vānarāḥ
translated: Then, the monkeys will see the Pandyan gate, made of gold, divine, adorned with pearls and gems,

original: tataḥ samudram āsādya saṃpradhāryārthaniścayam
analyzed: tatas samudram āsādya saṃpradhārya artha niścayam
translated: Approaching the ocean, having determined the purpose,

original: agastyenāntare tatra sāgare viniveśitaḥ🔽citranānānagaḥ śrīmān mahendraḥ parvatottamaḥ
analyzed: agastyena antare tatra sāgare viniveśitaḥ  citra nānā nagaḥ śrīmān mahendraḥ parvata uttamaḥ
translated: In that interval, the ocean was divided by Agastya.🔽The beautiful Mahendra, the best of mountains, is full of various colorful trees.

original: jātarūpamayaḥ śrīmān avagāḍho mahārṇavam
analyzed: jātarūpa mayaḥ śrīmān avagāḍhaḥ mahā arṇavam
translated: The beautiful mountain, made of gold, plunges into the great ocean.

original: nānāvidhair nagaiḥ phullair latābhiś copaśobhitam
analyzed: nānāvidhaiḥ nagaiḥ phullaiḥ latābhiḥ ca upaśobhitam
translated: It is adorned with various kinds of flowering trees and vines.

original: devarṣiyakṣapravarair apsarobhiś ca sevitam
analyzed: deva ṛṣi yakṣa pravaraiḥ apsarobhiḥ ca sevitam
translated: It is frequented by the best of gods, sages, yakshas and apsaras.

original: siddhacāraṇasaṃghaiś ca prakīrṇaṃ sumanoharam
analyzed: siddha cāraṇa saṃghaiḥ ca prakīrṇam su manoharam
translated: It is scattered with groups of siddhas and charanas, and is very beautiful.

original: tam upaiti sahasrākṣaḥ sadā parvasu parvasu
analyzed: tam upaiti sahasra akṣaḥ sadā parvasu parvasu
translated: The thousand-eyed one always goes there on the full moon days.

original: dvīpas tasyāpare pāre śatayojanam āyataḥ
analyzed: dvīpaḥ tasya apare pāre śata yojanam āyataḥ
translated: On the other side of that island, extending for a hundred yojanas,

original: agamyo mānuṣair dīptas taṃ mārgadhvaṃ samantataḥ
analyzed: agamyaḥ mānuṣaiḥ dīptaḥ tam mārgadhvam samantataḥ
translated: is a blazing place inaccessible to humans. Search for it all around.

original: tatra sarvātmanā sītā mārgitavyā viśeṣataḥ
analyzed: tatra sarva ātmanā sītā mārgitavyā viśeṣataḥ
translated: There, Sita should be searched for with all one's heart, especially.

original: sa hi deśas tu vadhyasya rāvaṇasya durātmanaḥ
analyzed: sa hi deśaḥ tu vadhyasya rāvaṇasya durātmanaḥ
translated: That place belongs to the wicked Ravan, the killer.

original: rākṣasādhipater vāsaḥ sahasrākṣasamadyuteḥ
analyzed: rākṣasa adhipateḥ vāsaḥ sahasrākṣa sama dyuteḥ
translated: The abode of the lord of rakshasas, equal in splendor to the thousand-eyed one,

original: dakṣiṇasya samudrasya madhye tasya tu rākṣasī
analyzed: dakṣiṇasya samudrasya madhye tasya tu rākṣasī
translated: in the middle of the southern ocean, is that of a rakshasi.

original: aṅgāraketi vikhyātā chāyām ākṣipya bhojinī
analyzed: aṅgāraka iti vikhyātā chāyām ākṣipya bhojinī
translated: Known as Angaraka, she devours after casting her shadow.

original: tam atikramya lakṣmīvān samudre śatayojane
analyzed: tam atikramya lakṣmīvān samudre śata yojane
translated: Beyond that, the prosperous ocean extends for a hundred yojanas.

original: giriḥ puṣpitako nāma siddhacāraṇasevitaḥ
analyzed: giriḥ puṣpitakaḥ nāma siddha cāraṇa sevitaḥ
translated: There is a mountain named Pūṣpita, frequented by siddhas and cāraṇas,

original: candrasūryāṃśusaṃkāśaḥ sāgarāmbusamāvṛtaḥ
translated: Resembling the rays of the sun and moon, surrounded by ocean waters,

original: bhrājate vipulaiḥ śṛṅgair ambaraṃ vilikhann iva🔽tasyaikaṃ kāñcanaṃ śṛṅgaṃ sevate yaṃ divākaraḥ
analyzed: bhrājate vipulaiḥ śṛṅgaiḥ ambaram vilikhan iva  tasya ekam kāñcanam śṛṅgam sevate yam divākaraḥ
translated: Shining with its vast peaks as if touching the sky.🔽One of its peaks is golden, which the sun frequents,

original: śvetaṃ rājatam ekaṃ ca sevate yaṃ niśākaraḥ
analyzed: śvetam rājatam ekam ca sevate yam niśākaraḥ
translated: And one is white and silver, which the moon frequents.

original: na taṃ kṛtaghnāḥ paśyanti na nṛśaṃsā na nāstikāḥ
analyzed: na tam kṛtaghnāḥ paśyanti na nṛśaṃsāḥ na nāstikāḥ
translated: The ungrateful, the cruel, and the atheists do not see it.

original: praṇamya śirasā śailaṃ taṃ vimārgata vānarāḥ
analyzed: praṇamya śirasā śailam tam vimārgata vānarāḥ
translated: Having bowed your heads to that mountain, search for her, O monkeys.

original: tam atikramya durdharṣāḥ sūryavān nāma parvataḥ
analyzed: tam atikramya durdharṣāḥ sūryavān nāma parvataḥ
translated: Having crossed that, there is an invincible mountain named Sūryavān,

original: adhvanā durvigāhena yojanāni caturdaśa
analyzed: adhvanā durvigāhena yojanāni caturdaśa
translated: Which is fourteen yojanas away, with a difficult path to traverse.

original: tatas tam apy atikramya vaidyuto nāma parvataḥ
analyzed: tatas tam api atikramya vaidyutaḥ nāma parvataḥ
translated: Then, having crossed that, there is a mountain named Vaidyuta,

original: sarvakāmaphalair vṛkṣaiḥ sarvakālamanoharaiḥ
analyzed: sarva kāma phalaiḥ vṛkṣaiḥ sarva kāla manoharaiḥ
translated: With trees bearing fruits of all desires, delightful in all seasons.

original: tatra bhuktvā varārhāṇi mūlāni ca phalāni ca
analyzed: tatra bhuktvā vara arhāṇi mūlāni ca phalāni ca
translated: Having eaten there the most desirable roots and fruits,

original: madhūni pītvā mukhyāni paraṃ gacchata vānarāḥ
analyzed: madhūni pītvā mukhyāni param gacchata vānarāḥ
translated: And having drunk the best honey, go further, O monkeys.

original: tatra netramanaḥkāntaḥ kuñjaro nāma parvataḥ
analyzed: tatra netra manaḥ kāntaḥ kuñjaraḥ nāma parvataḥ
translated: There is a mountain named Kuñjara, dear to the eyes and mind,

original: agastyabhavanaṃ yatra nirmitaṃ viśvakarmaṇā
analyzed: agastya bhavanam yatra nirmitam viśvakarmaṇā
translated: Where Agastya's abode was built by Viśvakarman,

original: tatra yojanavistāram ucchritaṃ daśayojanam
analyzed: tatra yojana vistāram ucchritam daśa yojanam
translated: There, ten yojanas high and one yojana wide,

original: śaraṇaṃ kāñcanaṃ divyaṃ nānāratnavibhūṣitam
analyzed: śaraṇam kāñcanam divyam nānā ratna vibhūṣitam
translated: is a divine golden shelter adorned with various jewels.

original: tatra bhogavatī nāma sarpāṇām ālayaḥ purī
analyzed: tatra bhogavatī nāma sarpāṇām ālayaḥ purī
translated: There, the city of the serpents named Bhogavatī,

original: viśālarathyā durdharṣā sarvataḥ parirakṣitā
analyzed: viśāla rathyā durdharṣā sarvatas parirakṣitā
translated: with wide streets, invincible, protected on all sides,

original: rakṣitā pannagair ghorais tīkṣṇadaṃṣṭrair mahāviṣaiḥ
analyzed: rakṣitā pannagaiḥ ghoraiḥ tīkṣṇa daṃṣṭraiḥ mahāviṣaiḥ
translated: is protected by terrible serpents with sharp fangs and great poison.

original: sarparājo mahāghoro yasyāṃ vasati vāsukiḥ
analyzed: sarpa rājaḥ mahā ghoraḥ yasyām vasati vāsukiḥ
translated: In it dwells the very terrible king of the serpents, Vāsuki.

original: niryāya mārgitavyā ca sā ca bhogavatī purī🔽taṃ ca deśam atikramya mahān ṛṣabhasaṃsthitaḥ
analyzed: niryāya mārgitavyā ca sā ca bhogavatī purī  tam ca deśam atikramya mahān ṛṣabha saṃsthitaḥ
translated: Having gone out, that city of Bhogavatī should be searched for.🔽And having passed that region, there is a great mountain named Ṛṣabha,

original: sarvaratnamayaḥ śrīmān ṛṣabho nāma parvataḥ🔽gośīrṣakaṃ padmakaṃ ca hariśyāmaṃ ca candanam
analyzed: sarva ratna mayaḥ śrīmān ṛṣabhaḥ nāma parvataḥ  gośīrṣakam padmakam ca hariśyāmam ca candanam
translated: standing like a bull, prosperous, made of all jewels.🔽There grows divine sandalwood, white as the moon,

original: divyam utpadyate yatra tac caivāgnisamaprabham
analyzed: divyam utpadyate yatra tat ca eva agni sama prabham
translated: and also that which has the luster of fire.

original: na tu tac candanaṃ dṛṣṭvā spraṣṭavyaṃ ca kadā cana
analyzed: na tu tat candanam dṛṣṭvā spraṣṭavyam ca kadā cana
translated: But that sandalwood should never be seen or touched.

original: rohitā nāma gandharvā ghorā rakṣanti tad vanam
analyzed: rohitāḥ nāma gandharvāḥ ghorāḥ rakṣanti tat vanam
translated: The terrible gandharvas named Rohiṇas protect that forest.

original: tatra gandharvapatayaḥ pañcasūryasamaprabhāḥ
analyzed: tatra gandharva patayaḥ pañca sūrya sama prabhāḥ
translated: There, the lords of the gandharvas, with the luster of five suns,

original: śailūṣo grāmaṇīr bhikṣuḥ śubhro babhrus tathaiva ca
analyzed: śailūṣaḥ grāmaṇīḥ bhikṣuḥ śubhraḥ babhruḥ tathā eva ca
translated: are Śailūṣa, Grāmaṇī, Bhikṣu, Śubhra, and Babhru.

original: ante pṛthivyā durdharṣās tatra svargajitaḥ sthitāḥ
analyzed: ante pṛthivyāḥ durdharṣāḥ tatra svarga jitaḥ sthitāḥ
translated: At the end of the earth, they are invincible, and there they abide, having conquered heaven.

original: tataḥ paraṃ na vaḥ sevyaḥ pitṛlokaḥ sudāruṇaḥ
analyzed: tatas param na vaḥ sevyaḥ pitṛ lokaḥ su dāruṇaḥ
translated: Beyond that, you should not go to the terrible world of the ancestors.

original: rājadhānī yamasyaiṣā kaṣṭena tamasāvṛtā🔽etāvad eva yuṣmābhir vīrā vānarapuṃgavāḥ
analyzed: rājadhānī yamasya eṣā kaṣṭena tamasā āvṛtā  etāvat eva yuṣmābhiḥ vīrāḥ vānara puṃgavāḥ
translated: This is the capital of Yama, enveloped in terrible darkness.

original: śakyaṃ vicetuṃ gantuṃ vā nāto gatimatāṃ gatiḥ
analyzed: śakyam vicetum gantum vā na atas gatimatām gatiḥ
translated: O heroes, O bulls among monkeys, this much is possible for you to search and go. Beyond this, there is no way for those who have the power to go.

original: sarvam etat samālokya yac cānyad api dṛśyate
analyzed: sarvam etat samālokya yat ca anyat api dṛśyate
translated: Having seen all this and whatever else is seen,

original: gatiṃ viditvā vaidehyāḥ saṃnivartitam arhatha
analyzed: gatim viditvā vaidehyāḥ saṃnivartitam arhatha
translated: having found out the way of Vaidehi, it is proper for you to return.

original: yas tu māsān nivṛtto 'gre dṛṣṭā sīteti vakṣyati
analyzed: yaḥ tu māsāt nivṛttaḥ gre dṛṣṭā sītā iti vakṣyati
translated: But he who, after a month, will say, 'I have seen Sita,'

original: mattulyavibhavo bhogaiḥ sukhaṃ sa vihariṣyati
analyzed: mad tulya vibhavaḥ bhogaiḥ sukham sa vihariṣyati
translated: he will enjoy happiness with pleasures equal to mine.

original: tataḥ priyataro nāsti mama prāṇād viśeṣataḥ
analyzed: tatas priyataraḥ nā asti mama prāṇāt viśeṣataḥ
translated: There is no one dearer to me than him, especially if he is my life.

original: kṛtāparādho bahuśo mama bandhur bhaviṣyati
analyzed: kṛta aparādhaḥ bahuśas mama bandhuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Even if he has committed many offenses, he will be my friend.

original: amitabalaparākramā bhavanto /
analyzed: amita bala parākramāḥ
translated: You have immeasurable strength and valor,

original: vipulaguṇeṣu kuleṣu ca prasūtāḥ
analyzed: vipula guṇeṣu kuleṣu ca prasūtāḥ
translated: born in families with abundant qualities.

original: manujapatisutāṃ yathā labhadhvaṃ /
analyzed: manuja pati sutām yathā labhadhvam
translated: Just as you obtained the daughter of the lord of men,

original: tad adhiguṇaṃ puruṣārtham ārabhadhvam
analyzed: tat adhiguṇam puruṣa artham ārabhadhvam
translated: strive for that superior human goal.

original: tataḥ prasthāpya sugrīvas tān harīn dakṣiṇāṃ diśam
analyzed: tatas prasthāpya sugrīvaḥ tān harīn dakṣiṇām diśam
translated: Then Sugriva dispatched those monkeys to the southern direction,

original: buddhivikramasaṃpannān vāyuvegasamāñjave
analyzed: buddhi vikrama saṃpannān vāyu vega samān jave
translated: Endowed with intelligence and valor, and swift like the speed of wind.

original: athāhūya mahātejāḥ suṣeṇaṃ nāma yūthapam
analyzed: atha āhūya mahā tejāḥ suṣeṇam nāma yūthapam
translated: Then the greatly radiant king, having summoned the leader named Sushena,

original: tārāyāḥ pitaraṃ rājā śvaśurabhīmavikramam
analyzed: tārāyāḥ pitaram rājā śvaśura bhīma vikramam
translated: The father of Tara, the father-in-law of terrible valor,

original: abravīt prāñjalir vākyam abhigamya praṇamya ca
analyzed: abravīt prāñjaliḥ vākyam abhigamya praṇamya ca
translated: Approached him with folded hands, bowed down, and spoke these words:

original: sāhāyyaṃ kuru rāmasya kṛtye 'smin samupasthite
analyzed: sāhāyyam kuru rāmasya kṛtye smin samupasthite
translated: Help Rama in this task that has presented itself.

original: vṛtaḥ śatasahasreṇa vānarāṇāṃ tarasvinām
analyzed: vṛtaḥ śata sahasreṇa vānarāṇām tarasvinām
translated: Surrounded by a hundred thousand swift monkeys,

original: abhigaccha diśaṃ saumya paścimāṃ vāruṇīṃ prabho🔽surāṣṭrān saha bāhlīkāñ śūrābhīrāṃs tathaiva ca
analyzed: abhigaccha diśam saumya paścimām vāruṇīm prabho  surāṣṭrān saha vāhlīkām śūra ābhīrān tathā eva ca
translated: O gentle one, O lord, go to the western direction, the direction of Varuna.

original: sphītāñjanapadān ramyān vipulāni purāṇi ca
analyzed: sphītān janapadān ramyān vipulāni purāṇi ca
translated: The prosperous, beautiful, and extensive cities of Surāṣṭra, Bāhīka, Śūra, and Ābhīra,

original: puṃnāgagahanaṃ kukṣiṃ bahuloddālakākulam
analyzed: puṃnāga gahanam kukṣim bahula uddālaka ākulam
translated: The dense forest of Punnāga trees, filled with many Uddālaka birds,

original: tathā ketakaṣaṇḍāṃś ca mārgadhvaṃ hariyūthapāḥ
analyzed: tathā ketaka ṣaṇḍān ca mārgadhvam hari yūthapāḥ
translated: And the groves of ketaka flowers - search for them, O leaders of the monkey troops.

original: pratyak srotogamāś caiva nadyaḥ śītajalāḥ śivāḥ🔽tāpasānām araṇyāni kāntārā girayaś ca ye
analyzed: pratyak srotaḥ gamāḥ ca eva nadyaḥ śīta jalāḥ śivāḥ  tāpasānām araṇyāni kāntārāḥ girayaḥ ca ye
translated: The auspicious rivers flowing westwards with cool waters,🔽The forests of ascetics, the wildernesses, and the mountains,

original: girijālāvṛtāṃ durgāṃ mārgitvā paścimāṃ diśam
analyzed: giri jāla āvṛtām durgām mārgitvā paścimām diśam
translated: Having searched the western direction, which is covered with mountain ranges and difficult to traverse,

original: tataḥ paścimam āsādya samudraṃ draṣṭum arhatha
analyzed: tatas paścimam āsādya samudram draṣṭum arhatha
translated: Then having reached the western direction, you should see the ocean.

original: timi nakrāyuta jalam akṣobhyam atha vānaraḥ🔽tataḥ ketakaṣaṇḍeṣu tamālagahaneṣu ca
analyzed: timi nakrāyuta jalam akṣobhyam atha vānaraḥ  tatas ketaka ṣaṇḍeṣu tamāla gahaneṣu ca
translated: The ocean, with its waters agitated by whales and sharks, is unfathomable.🔽Then the monkeys will roam in the Ketaka groves, the Tamala thickets,

original: kapayo vihariṣyanti nārikelavaneṣu ca
analyzed: kapayaḥ vihariṣyanti nārikela vaneṣu ca
translated: And in the coconut groves.

original: tatra sītāṃ ca mārgadhvaṃ nilayaṃ rāvaṇasya ca
analyzed: tatra sītām ca mārgadhvam nilayam rāvaṇasya ca
translated: There you should search for Sita and Ravana's abode,

original: marīcipattanaṃ caiva ramyaṃ caiva jaṭīpuram
analyzed: marīcipattanam ca eva ramyam ca eva jaṭī puram
translated: The beautiful city of Maricha, and the city of Jati,

original: avantīm aṅgalopāṃ ca tathā cālakṣitaṃ vanam
analyzed: avantīm aṅgalopām ca tathā ca ālakṣitam vanam
translated: Avanti, Angalopam, and the unobserved forest,

original: rāṣṭrāṇi ca viśālāni pattanāni tatas tataḥ
analyzed: rāṣṭrāṇi ca viśālāni pattanāni tatas tatas
translated: And the vast kingdoms and cities here and there,

original: sindhusāgarayoś caiva saṃgame tatra parvataḥ
analyzed: sindhu sāgarayoḥ ca eva saṃgame tatra parvataḥ
translated: And at the confluence of the Sindhu and the ocean, there is a mountain

original: mahān hemagirir nāma śataśṛṅgo mahādrumaḥ
analyzed: mahān hemagiriḥ nāma śata śṛṅgaḥ mahā drumaḥ
translated: Called Hemagiri, a great mountain with a hundred peaks and large trees.

original: tasya prastheṣu ramyeṣu siṃhāḥ pakṣagamāḥ sthitāḥ🔽timimatsyagajāṃś caiva nīḍāny āropayanti te🔽tāni nīḍāni siṃhānāṃ giriśṛṅgagatāś ca ye
analyzed: tasya prastheṣu ramyeṣu siṃhāḥ pakṣagamāḥ sthitāḥ  timi matsya gajān ca eva nīḍāni āropayanti te  tāni nīḍāni siṃhānām giri śṛṅga gatāḥ ca ye
translated: On its delightful plateaus, winged lions reside,🔽And they carry fish and elephants to their nests.🔽Those lions' nests are on the mountain peaks,

original: dṛptās tṛptāś ca mātaṅgās toyadasvananiḥsvanāḥ
analyzed: dṛptāḥ tṛptāḥ ca mātaṅgāḥ toyada svana niḥsvanāḥ
translated: And the proud and satisfied elephants, with the sound of thundering clouds,

original: vicaranti viśāle 'smiṃs toyapūrṇe samantataḥ
analyzed: vicaranti viśāle smin toya pūrṇe samantataḥ
translated: Roam all around in this vast area filled with water.

original: tasya śṛṅgaṃ divasparśaṃ kāñcanaṃ citrapādapam
analyzed: tasya śṛṅgam diva sparśam kāñcanam citra pādapam
translated: Its peak touches the sky, golden, with colorful trees,

original: sarvam āśu vicetavyaṃ kapibhiḥ kāmarūpibhiḥ
analyzed: sarvam āśu vicetavyam kapibhiḥ kāmarūpibhiḥ
translated: Everything should be quickly searched by the monkeys who can assume any form at will.

original: koṭiṃ tatra samudre tu kāñcanīṃ śatayojanam
analyzed: koṭim tatra samudre tu kāñcanīm śata yojanam
translated: There, in the ocean, is a golden peak a hundred yojanas long,

original: durdarśāṃ pariyātrasya gatā drakṣyatha vānarāḥ🔽koṭyas tatra caturviṃśad gandharvāṇāṃ tarasvinām
analyzed: durdarśām pariyātrasya gatāḥ drakṣyatha vānarāḥ  koṭyaḥ tatra caturviṃśat gandharvāṇām tarasvinām
translated: difficult to see, of Pariyatra. Having gone there, O monkeys, you will see.🔽There are twenty-four koṭis of swift Gandharvas,

original: vasanty agninikāśānāṃ ghorāṇāṃ kāmarūpiṇām
analyzed: vasanti agni nikāśānām ghorāṇām kāmarūpiṇām
translated: residing there, resembling fire, terrible, able to assume any form at will.

original: nātyāsādayitavyās te vānarair bhīmavikramaiḥ
analyzed: na atyāsādayitavyāḥ te vānaraiḥ bhīma vikramaiḥ
translated: They should not be approached by the monkeys of terrible prowess.

original: nādeyaṃ ca phalaṃ tasmād deśāt kiṃ cit plavaṃgamaiḥ
analyzed: na ādeyam ca phalam tasmāt deśāt kim cit plavaṃgamaiḥ
translated: And nothing should be taken away as fruit from that region by the monkeys.

original: durāsadā hi te vīrāḥ sattvavanto mahābalāḥ
analyzed: durāsadāḥ hi te vīrāḥ sattvavantaḥ mahā balāḥ
translated: For they are invincible, heroic, powerful,

original: phalamūlāni te tatra rakṣante bhīmavikramāḥ
analyzed: phala mūlāni te tatra rakṣante bhīma vikramāḥ
translated: and they guard the fruits and roots there with terrible prowess.

original: tatra yatnaś ca kartavyo mārgitavyā ca jānakī
analyzed: tatra yatnaḥ ca kartavyaḥ mārgitavyā ca jānakī
translated: And effort should be made there, and Jānaki should be sought.

original: na hi tebhyo bhayaṃ kiṃ cit kapitvam anuvartatām
analyzed: na hi tebhyaḥ bhayam kim cit kapi tvam anuvartatām
translated: For you should not fear them at all, while following the monkey nature.

original: caturbhāge samudrasya cakravān nāma parvataḥ
analyzed: caturbhāge samudrasya cakravān nāma parvataḥ
translated: In the fourth part of the ocean, there is a mountain named Cakravān.

original: tatra cakraṃ sahasrāraṃ nirmitaṃ viśvakarmaṇā🔽tatra pañcajanaṃ hatvā hayagrīvaṃ ca dānavam
analyzed: tatra cakram sahasra aram nirmitam viśvakarmaṇā  tatra pañcajanam hatvā hayagrīvam ca dānavam
translated: There, a thousand-spoked wheel was fashioned by Viśvakarman.🔽There, having killed the demon Pañcajana and Hayagrīva,

original: ājahāra tataś cakraṃ śaṅkhaṃ ca puruṣottamaḥ
analyzed: ājahāra tatas cakram śaṅkham ca puruṣottamaḥ
translated: the Supreme Being then obtained the discus and the conch.

original: tasya sānuṣu citreṣu viśālāsu guhāsu ca
analyzed: tasya sānuṣu citreṣu viśālāsu guhāsu ca
translated: On its colorful peaks and vast caves,

original: rāvaṇaḥ saha vaidehyā mārgitavyas tatas tataḥ
analyzed: rāvaṇaḥ saha vaidehyā mārgitavyaḥ tatas tatas
translated: Ravana should be searched for here and there with Vaidehi.

original: yojanāni catuḥṣaṣṭir varāho nāma parvataḥ
analyzed: yojanāni catuḥṣaṣṭiḥ varāhaḥ nāma parvataḥ
translated: There is a mountain named Varaha, sixty-four yojanas away,

original: suvarṇaśṛṅgaḥ suśrīmān agādhe varuṇālaye
analyzed: suvarṇa śṛṅgaḥ suśrīmān agādhe varuṇālaye
translated: with golden peaks, very beautiful, in the unfathomable abode of Varuna.

original: tatra prāgjyotiṣaṃ nāma jātarūpamayaṃ puram
analyzed: tatra prāgjyotiṣam nāma jātarūpa mayam puram
translated: There is a city named Pragjyotisha, made of gold,

original: yasmin vasti duṣṭātmā narako nāma guhāsu ca
analyzed: yasmin duṣṭa ātmā narakaḥ nāma guhāsu ca
translated: where the evil-minded one named Naraka resides in the caves.

original: tasya sānuṣu citreṣu viśālāsu guhāsu ca
analyzed: tasya sānuṣu citreṣu viśālāsu guhāsu ca
translated: On its colorful peaks and vast caves,

original: rāvaṇaḥ saha vaidehyā mārgitavyas tatas tataḥ🔽tam atikramya śailendraṃ kāñcanāntaranirdaraḥ
analyzed: rāvaṇaḥ saha vaidehyā mārgitavyaḥ tatas tatas  tam atikramya śaila indram kāñcana antara nirdaraḥ
translated: Ravana should be searched for here and there with Vaidehi.🔽Beyond that king of mountains, with its interior of gold,

original: parvataḥ sarvasauvarṇo dhārā prasravaṇāyutaḥ
analyzed: parvataḥ sarva sauvarṇaḥ dhārā prasravaṇa āyutaḥ
translated: there is a mountain entirely made of gold, with ten thousand waterfalls.

original: taṃ gajāś ca varāhāś ca siṃhā vyāghrāś ca sarvataḥ
analyzed: tam gajāḥ ca varāhāḥ ca siṃhāḥ vyāghrāḥ ca sarvatas
translated: There, elephants, boars, lions and tigers everywhere

original: abhigarjanti satataṃ tena śabdena darpitāḥ
analyzed: abhigarjanti satatam tena śabdena darpitāḥ
translated: roar constantly, intoxicated by that sound.

original: tasmin harihayaḥ śrīmān mahendraḥ pākaśāsanaḥ
analyzed: tasmin harihayaḥ śrīmān mahā indraḥ pākaśāsanaḥ
translated: On that mountain, the glorious great Indra, the chastiser of Paka, with his horses of gold,

original: abhiṣiktaḥ surai rājā meghavān nāma parvataḥ
analyzed: abhiṣiktaḥ suraiḥ rājā meghavān nāma parvataḥ
translated: was consecrated as the king by the gods. The mountain is named Meghavat.

original: tam atikramya śailendraṃ mahendraparipālitam
analyzed: tam atikramya śaila indram mahā indra paripālitam
translated: Beyond that king of mountains, protected by great Indra,

original: ṣaṣṭiṃ girisahasrāṇi kāñcanāni gamiṣyatha
analyzed: ṣaṣṭim giri sahasrāṇi kāñcanāni gamiṣyatha
translated: You will go to sixty thousand golden mountains,

original: taruṇādityavarṇāni bhrājamānāni sarvataḥ
analyzed: taruṇa āditya varṇāni bhrājamānāni sarvatas
translated: Shining everywhere with the color of the rising sun,

original: jātarūpamayair vṛkṣaiḥ śobhitāni supuṣpitaiḥ
analyzed: jātarūpa mayaiḥ vṛkṣaiḥ śobhitāni su puṣpitaiḥ
translated: Adorned with trees made of gold, beautifully blossoming.

original: teṣāṃ madhye sthito rājā merur uttamaparvataḥ
analyzed: teṣām madhye sthitaḥ rājā meruḥ uttama parvataḥ
translated: In their midst stands King Meru, the supreme mountain,

original: ādityena prasannena śailo dattavaraḥ purā🔽tenaivam uktaḥ śailendraḥ sarva eva tvadāśrayāḥ
analyzed: ādityena prasannena śailaḥ datta varaḥ purā  tena evam uktaḥ śailendraḥ sarvaḥ eva tvad āśrayāḥ
translated: The mountain was told by the pleased sun in the past:

original: matprasādād bhaviṣyanti divārātrau ca kāñcanāḥ
analyzed: mad prasādāt bhaviṣyanti divārātrau ca kāñcanāḥ
translated: By my grace, all of them will be golden during the day and night.

original: tvayi ye cāpi vatsyanti devagandharvadānavāḥ
analyzed: tvayi ye ca api vatsyanti deva gandharva dānavāḥ
translated: And those gods, gandharvas, and demons who will dwell on you,

original: te bhaviṣyanti raktāś ca prabhayā kāñcanaprabhāḥ
analyzed: te bhaviṣyanti raktāḥ ca prabhayā kāñcana prabhāḥ
translated: They will also be red, shining with the radiance of gold.

original: ādityā vasavo rudrā marutaś ca divaukasaḥ
analyzed: ādityāḥ vasavaḥ rudrāḥ marutaḥ ca divaukasaḥ
translated: The Adityas, Vasus, Rudras, Maruts, and other dwellers of heaven,

original: āgamya paścimāṃ saṃdhyāṃ merum uttamaparvatam
analyzed: āgamya paścimām saṃdhyām merum uttama parvatam
translated: Having come to the western twilight on Meru, the supreme mountain,

original: ādityam upatiṣṭhanti taiś ca sūryo 'bhipūjitaḥ
analyzed: ādityam upatiṣṭhanti taiḥ ca sūryaḥ abhipūjitaḥ
translated: Worship the sun, and the sun, worshipped by them,

original: adṛśyaḥ sarvabhūtānām astaṃ gacchati parvatam
analyzed: adṛśyaḥ sarva bhūtānām astam gacchati parvatam
translated: Becomes invisible to all beings as it sets behind the mountain.

original: yojanānāṃ sahasrāṇi daśatāni divākaraḥ
analyzed: yojanānām sahasrāṇi daśatāni divākaraḥ
translated: The sun travels ten thousand leagues

original: muhūrtārdhena taṃ śīghram abhiyāti śiloccayam
analyzed: muhūrta ardhena tam śīghram abhiyāti śiloccayam
translated: In half a muhurta to that high mountain.

original: śṛṅge tasya mahad divyaṃ bhavanaṃ sūryasaṃnibham
analyzed: śṛṅge tasya mahat divyam bhavanam sūrya saṃnibham
translated: On its peak is a great divine palace, resembling the sun,

original: prāsādaguṇasaṃbādhaṃ vihitaṃ viśvakarmaṇā
analyzed: prāsāda guṇa saṃbādham vihitam viśvakarmaṇā
translated: crowded with the qualities of a palace, constructed by Vishvakarma,

original: śobhitaṃ tarubhiś citrair nānāpakṣisamākulaiḥ
analyzed: śobhitam tarubhiḥ citraiḥ nānā pakṣi samākulaiḥ
translated: adorned with colorful trees, filled with various birds,

original: niketaṃ pāśahastasya varuṇasya mahātmanaḥ
analyzed: niketam pāśa hastasya varuṇasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: the abode of the great-souled Varuna, the wielder of the noose.

original: antarā merum astaṃ ca tālo daśaśirā mahān
analyzed: antarā merum astam ca tālaḥ daśaśirāḥ mahān
translated: Between Meru and Asta, there is a great palm tree with ten heads,

original: jātarūpamayaḥ śrīmān bhrājate citravedikaḥ
analyzed: jātarūpa mayaḥ śrīmān bhrājate citra vedikaḥ
translated: made of gold, prosperous, shining with a colorful altar.

original: teṣu sarveṣu durgeṣu saraḥsu ca saritsu ca
analyzed: teṣu sarveṣu durgeṣu saraḥsu ca saritsu ca
translated: In all those inaccessible places, in the lakes and rivers,

original: rāvaṇaḥ saha vaidehyā mārgitavyas tatas tataḥ
analyzed: rāvaṇaḥ saha vaidehyā mārgitavyaḥ tatas tatas
translated: Ravana should be searched for, along with Vaidehi, here and there.

original: yatra tiṣṭhati dharmātmā tapasā svena bhāvitaḥ
analyzed: yatra tiṣṭhati dharma ātmā tapasā svena bhāvitaḥ
translated: Where the righteous one resides, perfected by his own austerities,

original: merusāvarṇir ity eva khyāto vai brahmaṇā samaḥ
analyzed: merusāvarṇiḥ iti eva khyātaḥ vai brahmaṇā samaḥ
translated: known as Meru Savarni, equal to Brahma himself.

original: praṣṭavyo merusāvarṇir maharṣiḥ sūryasaṃnibhaḥ
analyzed: praṣṭavyaḥ merusāvarṇiḥ mahā ṛṣiḥ sūrya saṃnibhaḥ
translated: The great sage Meru Savarni, resembling the sun, should be asked.

original: praṇamya śirasā bhūmau pravṛttiṃ maithilīṃ prati
analyzed: praṇamya śirasā bhūmau pravṛttim maithilīm prati
translated: Bowing his head to the ground, he should inquire about the whereabouts of Maithilee.

original: etāvaj jīvalokasya bhāskaro rajanīkṣaye
analyzed: etāvat jīva lokasya bhāskaraḥ rajanī kṣaye
translated: This much is the extent of the world of the living, where the sun, at the end of the night,

original: kṛtvā vitimiraṃ sarvam astaṃ gacchati parvatam
analyzed: kṛtvā vitimiram sarvam astam gacchati parvatam
translated: having removed all darkness, goes to the mountain to set.

original: etāvad vānaraiḥ śakyaṃ gantuṃ vānarapuṃgavāḥ
analyzed: etāvat vānaraiḥ śakyam gantum vānara puṃgavāḥ
translated: This much is the extent to which monkeys, the best of monkeys, are able to go.

original: abhāskaram amaryādaṃ na jānīmas tataḥ param
analyzed: abhāskaram amaryādam na jānīmaḥ tatas param
translated: Beyond that, we do not know anything, as it is beyond the sun and has no boundaries.

original: adhigamya tu vaidehīṃ nilayaṃ rāvaṇasya ca
analyzed: adhigamya tu vaidehīm nilayam rāvaṇasya ca
translated: But having found Vaidehi and Ravana's abode,

original: astaṃ parvatam āsādya pūrṇe māse nivartata🔽ūrdhvaṃ māsān na vastavyaṃ vasan vadhyo bhaven mama
analyzed: astam parvatam āsādya pūrṇe māse nivartata  ūrdhvam māsāt na vastavyam vasan vadhyaḥ bhavet mama
translated: having reached Mount Asta, return after a full month.🔽You should not stay beyond a month, for if you do, you will be killed by me.

original: sahaiva śūro yuṣmābhiḥ śvaśuro me gamiṣyati
analyzed: saha eva śūraḥ yuṣmābhiḥ śvaśuraḥ me gamiṣyati
translated: The hero, my father-in-law, will go with you all.

original: śrotavyaṃ sarvam etasya bhavadbhir diṣṭa kāribhiḥ
analyzed: śrotavyam sarvam etasya bhavadbhiḥ diṣṭa kāribhiḥ
translated: You who carry out my orders, all of you should listen to him.

original: gurur eṣa mahābāhuḥ śvaśuro me mahābalaḥ
analyzed: guruḥ eṣa mahā bāhuḥ śvaśuraḥ me mahā balaḥ
translated: This is my father-in-law, the mighty-armed one, the greatly strong one.

original: bhavantaś cāpi vikrāntāḥ pramāṇaṃ sarvakarmasu
analyzed: bhavantaḥ ca api vikrāntāḥ pramāṇam sarva karmasu
translated: And you all are valiant, the authority in all matters.

original: pramāṇam enaṃ saṃsthāpya paśyadhvaṃ paścimāṃ diśam
analyzed: pramāṇam enam saṃsthāpya paśyadhvam paścimām diśam
translated: Having established him as the authority, see the western direction.

original: dṛṣṭāyāṃ tu narendrasyā patnyām amitatejasaḥ
analyzed: dṛṣṭāyām tu patnyām amita tejasaḥ
translated: But when the wife of the king of immeasurable splendor is seen,

original: kṛtakṛtyā bhaviṣyāmaḥ kṛtasya pratikarmaṇā
analyzed: kṛtakṛtyāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ kṛtasya pratikarmaṇā
translated: we will have done our duty, having repaid the debt of what was done.

original: ato 'nyad api yat kiṃ cit kāryasyāsya hitaṃ bhavet
analyzed: atas nyat api yat kim cit kāryasya asya hitam bhavet
translated: And whatever else may be beneficial for this task,

original: saṃpradhārya bhavadbhiś ca deśakālārthasaṃhitam
analyzed: saṃpradhārya bhavadbhiḥ ca deśa kāla artha saṃhitam
translated: having considered it together with you, in accordance with place, time and purpose,

original: tataḥ suṣeṇa pramukhāḥ plavaṃgamāḥ /
analyzed: tatas suṣeṇa pramukhāḥ plavaṃgamāḥ
translated: then the monkeys led by Sushena,

original: sugrīvavākyaṃ nipuṇaṃ niśamya
analyzed: sugrīva vākyam nipuṇam niśamya
translated: having heard Sugriva's skillful words,

original: āmantrya sarve plavagādhipaṃ te /
analyzed: āmantrya sarve plavaga adhipam te
translated: All those monkeys, having taken leave of the lord of monkeys,

original: jagmur diśaṃ tāṃ varuṇābhiguptām
analyzed: jagmuḥ diśam tām varuṇa abhiguptām
translated: went to that direction protected by Varuna.

original: tataḥ saṃdiśya sugrīvaḥ śvaśuraṃ paścimāṃ diśam
analyzed: tatas saṃdiśya sugrīvaḥ śvaśuram paścimām diśam
translated: Then Sugriva, the bull among monkeys, having instructed his father-in-law

original: vīraṃ śatabaliṃ nāma vānaraṃ vānararṣabhaḥ
analyzed: vīram śatabalim nāma vānaram vānara ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: in the western direction, the heroic Shatabali,

original: uvāca rājā mantrajñaḥ sarvavānarasaṃmatam
analyzed: uvāca rājā mantra jñaḥ sarva vānara saṃmatam
translated: the king who knew counsel, spoke to the monkey who was respected by all monkeys,

original: vākyam ātmahitaṃ caiva rāmasya ca hitaṃ tathā
analyzed: vākyam ātma hitam ca eva rāmasya ca hitam tathā
translated: words that were beneficial for himself and also for Rama.

original: vṛtaḥ śatasahasreṇa tvadvidhānāṃ vanaukasām
analyzed: vṛtaḥ śata sahasreṇa tvadvidhānām vanaukasām
translated: Surrounded by a hundred thousand forest-dwellers like you,

original: vaivasvata sutaiḥ sārdhaṃ pratiṣṭhasva svamantribhiḥ
analyzed: vaivasvata sutaiḥ sārdham pratiṣṭhasva sva mantribhiḥ
translated: together with the sons of Vaivasvata, set out with your own ministers.

original: diśaṃ hy udīcīṃ vikrāntāṃ himaśailāvataṃsakām
analyzed: diśam hi udīcīm vikrāntām himaśaila avataṃsakām
translated: In the northern direction, which is vast, adorned with the Himalaya mountains,

original: sarvataḥ parimārgadhvaṃ rāmapatnīm aninditām🔽asmin kārye vinivṛtte kṛte dāśaratheḥ priye
analyzed: sarvatas parimārgadhvam rāma patnīm aninditām  asmin kārye vinivṛtte kṛte dāśaratheḥ priye
translated: search everywhere for Rama's unblemished wife.🔽When this task is accomplished and Dasharatha's son is pleased,

original: ṛṇān muktā bhaviṣyāmaḥ kṛtārthārthavidāṃ varāḥ
analyzed: ṛṇāt muktāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ kṛtārtha artha vidām varāḥ
translated: we will be freed from debt and will be the best among those who have accomplished their purpose.

original: kṛtaṃ hi priyam asmākaṃ rāghaveṇa mahātmanā
analyzed: kṛtam hi priyam asmākam rāghaveṇa mahātmanā
translated: The great-souled Raghava has indeed done what is pleasing to us.

original: tasya cet pratikāro 'sti saphalaṃ jīvitaṃ bhavet
analyzed: tasya ced saphalam jīvitam bhavet
translated: If there is a return for that, life would be fruitful.

original: etāṃ buddhiṃ samāsthāya dṛśyate jānakī yathā
analyzed: etām buddhim samāsthāya dṛśyate jānakī yathā
translated: Having set this as our goal, we will see how Janakee is.

original: tathā bhavadbhiḥ kartavyam asmatpriyahitaiṣibhiḥ
analyzed: tathā bhavadbhiḥ kartavyam asmad priya hita eṣibhiḥ
translated: You who seek our welfare and benefit should act in this way.

original: ayaṃ hi sarvabhūtānāṃ mānyas tu narasattamaḥ
analyzed: ayam hi sarva bhūtānām mānyaḥ tu nara sattamaḥ
translated: For this best of men is to be honored by all beings.

original: asmāsu cāgataprītī rāmaḥ parapuraṃjayaḥ
analyzed: asmāsu ca āgata prītiḥ rāmaḥ parapuraṃjayaḥ
translated: And Rama, the conqueror of enemy cities, has come to love us.

original: imāni vanadurgāṇi nadyaḥ śailāntarāṇi ca
analyzed: imāni vana durgāṇi nadyaḥ śaila antarāṇi ca
translated: These forests, inaccessible mountains, rivers and mountain valleys

original: bhavantaḥ parimārgaṃs tu buddhivikramasaṃpadā
analyzed: bhavantaḥ tu buddhi vikrama saṃpadā
translated: You should search with your wealth of intelligence and valor.

original: tatra mlecchān pulindāṃś ca śūrasenāṃs tathāiva ca
analyzed: tatra mlecchān pulindān ca śūrasenān tathā iva ca
translated: There, among the Mlecchas, Pulindas, Shurasenas,

original: prasthālān bharatāṃś caiva kurūṃś ca saha madrakaiḥ
analyzed: prasthālān bharatān ca eva kurūn ca saha madrakaiḥ
translated: Prasthalas, Bharatas, Kurus with the Madrakas,

original: kāmbojān yavanāṃś caiva śakān āraṭṭakān api
analyzed: kāmbojān yavanān ca eva śakān āraṭṭakān api
translated: Kambojas, Yavanas, Shakas, and Arattas,

original: bāhlīkān ṛṣikāṃś caiva pauravān atha ṭaṅkaṇān
analyzed: vāhlīkān ṛṣikān ca eva pauravān atha ṭaṅkaṇān
translated: Bahlikas, Rishis, Pauravas, and Tankanas,

original: cīnān paramacīnāṃś ca nīhārāṃś ca punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: cīnān parama cīnān ca nīhārān ca punar punar
translated: Chinas, Parachinas, and Niharas again and again,

original: anviṣya daradāṃś caiva himavantaṃ vicinvatha
analyzed: anviṣya daradān ca eva himavantam vicinu atha
translated: Having searched, you should look for the Daradas and the Himalayas.

original: lodhrapadmakaṣaṇḍeṣu devadāruvaneṣu ca
translated: In the thickets of Lodhra and Padmaka, in the forests of Devadaru,

original: rāvaṇaḥ saha vaidehya mārgitavyas tatas tataḥ
analyzed: rāvaṇaḥ saha vaidehya mārgitavyaḥ tatas tatas
translated: Ravana should be sought out with Vaidehi here and there.

original: tataḥ somāśramaṃ gatvā devagandharvasevitam
analyzed: tatas somāśramam gatvā deva gandharva sevitam
translated: Then, having gone to Soma's hermitage, frequented by gods and gandharvas,

original: kālaṃ nāma mahāsānuṃ parvataṃ taṃ gamiṣyatha
analyzed: kālam nāma mahā sānum parvatam tam gamiṣyatha
translated: You should go to that mountain named Kala, with a great peak.

original: mahatsu tasya śṛṅgeṣu nirdareṣu guhāsu ca
analyzed: mahatsu tasya śṛṅgeṣu nirdareṣu guhāsu ca
translated: On its great peaks, in its hollow and cave-like places,

original: vicinudhvaṃ mahābhāgāṃ rāmapatnīṃ yaśasvinīm
analyzed: vicinudhvam mahābhāgām rāma patnīm yaśasvinīm
translated: Search for the illustrious and greatly fortunate wife of Rama.

original: tam atikramya śailendraṃ hemavargaṃ mahāgirim
analyzed: tam atikramya śaila indram hema vargam mahā girim
translated: Having crossed that king of mountains, the great mountain Hemavarga,

original: tataḥ sudarśanaṃ nāma parvataṃ gantum arhatha
analyzed: tatas sudarśanam nāma parvatam gantum arhatha
translated: You should then go to the mountain named Sudarshana.

original: tasya kānanaṣaṇḍeṣu nirdareṣu guhāsu ca
analyzed: tasya kānana ṣaṇḍeṣu nirdareṣu guhāsu ca
translated: In its forest groves, hollow and cave-like places,

original: rāvaṇaḥ saha vaidehyā mārgitavyas tatas tataḥ
analyzed: rāvaṇaḥ saha vaidehyā mārgitavyaḥ tatas tatas
translated: Ravana should be searched for along with Vaidehi here and there.

original: tam atikramya cākāśaṃ sarvataḥ śatayojanam
analyzed: tam atikramya ca ākāśam sarvatas śata yojanam
translated: Beyond that, the sky is a hundred yojanas on all sides,

original: aparvatanadī vṛkṣaṃ sarvasattvavivarjitam
analyzed: aparvata nadī vṛkṣam sarva sattva vivarjitam
translated: Without mountains, rivers, trees, and devoid of all beings.

original: taṃ tu śīghram atikramya kāntāraṃ romaharṣaṇam
analyzed: tam tu śīghram atikramya kāntāram roma harṣaṇam
translated: Having quickly crossed that forest causing horripilation,

original: kailāsaṃ pāṇḍuraṃ śailaṃ prāpya hṛṣṭā bhaviṣyatha
analyzed: kailāsam pāṇḍuram śailam prāpya hṛṣṭāḥ bhaviṣyatha
translated: Reaching the white mountain Kailash, you will be delighted.

original: tatra pāṇḍurameghābhaṃ jāmbūnadapariṣkṛtam
analyzed: tatra pāṇḍura megha ābham jāmbūnada pariṣkṛtam
translated: There, resembling a white cloud, adorned with gold,

original: kuberabhavanaṃ divyaṃ nirmitaṃ viśvakarmaṇā
analyzed: kubera bhavanam divyam nirmitam viśvakarmaṇā
translated: Kubera's divine abode is constructed by Vishvakarma.

original: viśālā nalinī yatra prabhūtakamalotpalā
analyzed: viśālā nalinī yatra prabhūta kamala utpalā
translated: There is a vast lotus pond filled with many lotuses and lilies,

original: haṃsakāraṇḍavākīrṇā apsarogaṇasevitā
analyzed: haṃsa kāraṇḍava ākīrṇā apsaraḥ gaṇa sevitā
translated: Crowded with swans and ducks, frequented by groups of celestial nymphs.

original: tatra vaiśravaṇo rājā sarvabhūtanamaskṛtaḥ
analyzed: tatra vaiśravaṇaḥ rājā sarva bhūta namaskṛtaḥ
translated: There, King Vaishravana, revered by all beings,

original: dhanado ramate śrīmān guhyakaiḥ saha yakṣarāṭ
analyzed: dhanadaḥ ramate śrīmān guhyakaiḥ saha yakṣa rāj
translated: The prosperous lord of wealth, the king of Yakshas, delights with the Guhyakas.

original: tasya candranikaśeṣu parvateṣu guhāsu ca
analyzed: tasya candra nikaśeṣu parvateṣu guhāsu ca
translated: In the caves of the mountains, in the light of the moon,

original: rāvaṇaḥ saha vaidehyā mārgitavyas tatas tataḥ
analyzed: rāvaṇaḥ saha vaidehyā mārgitavyaḥ tatas tatas
translated: And Rāvana, together with Vaidehī, should be sought in the caves of the mountains, in the clefts of the moon.

original: krauñcaṃ tu girim āsādya bilaṃ tasya sudurgamam
analyzed: krauñcam tu girim āsādya bilam tasya su durgamam
translated: Having reached Mount Krauñca, whose cave is difficult to access,

original: apramattaiḥ praveṣṭavyaṃ duṣpraveśaṃ hi tat smṛtam
analyzed: apramattaiḥ praveṣṭavyam duṣpraveśam hi tat smṛtam
translated: one should enter it with care, for it is remembered as difficult to enter.

original: vasanti hi mahātmānas tatra sūryasamaprabhāḥ
analyzed: vasanti hi mahātmānaḥ tatra sūrya sama prabhāḥ
translated: For there dwell great souls, radiant like the sun,

original: devair apy arcitāḥ samyag devarūpā maharṣayaḥ
analyzed: devaiḥ api arcitāḥ samyak deva rūpāḥ mahā ṛṣayaḥ
translated: great sages, who are worshipped even by the gods, who are of divine form.

original: krauñcasya tu guhāś cānyāḥ sānūni śikharāṇi ca
analyzed: krauñcasya tu guhāḥ ca anyāḥ sānūni śikharāṇi ca
translated: And the other caves of Krauñca, its slopes and peaks,

original: nirdarāś ca nitambāś ca vicetavyās tatas tataḥ
analyzed: nirdarāḥ ca nitambāḥ ca vicetavyāḥ tatas tatas
translated: its chasms and cliffs, should be searched here and there.

original: krauñcasya śikharaṃ cāpi nirīkṣya ca tatas tataḥ
analyzed: krauñcasya śikharam ca api nirīkṣya ca tatas tatas
translated: And having looked here and there at the peak of Krauñca,

original: avṛkṣaṃ kāmaśailaṃ ca mānasaṃ vihagālayam
analyzed: avṛkṣam kāmaśailam ca mānasam vihaga ālayam
translated: and at Kāmaśaila, which is without trees, and at Mānasa, the abode of birds,

original: na gatis tatra bhūtānāṃ devadānavarakṣasām
analyzed: na gatiḥ tatra bhūtānām deva dānava rakṣasām
translated: there is no access for beings, for gods, demons, or rākṣasas.

original: sa ca sarvair vicetavyaḥ sasānuprasthabhūdharaḥ
analyzed: sa ca sarvaiḥ vicetavyaḥ sasānu prastha bhūdharaḥ
translated: And that (mountain) should be searched by all, with its slopes and ridges.

original: krauñcaṃ girim atikramya maināko nāma parvataḥ
analyzed: krauñcam girim atikramya mainākaḥ nāma parvataḥ
translated: Beyond Krauñca, there is a mountain named Maināka,

original: mayasya bhavanaṃ tatra dānavasya svayaṃ kṛtam
analyzed: mayasya bhavanam tatra dānavasya svayam kṛtam
translated: where is the abode of the demon Maya, built by himself.

original: mainākas tu vicetavyaḥ sasānuprasthakandaraḥ
analyzed: mainākaḥ tu vicetavyaḥ sasānu prastha kandaraḥ
translated: And Maināka should be searched, with its slopes, ridges, and caverns.

original: strīṇām aśvamukhīnāṃ ca niketās tatra tatra tu
analyzed: strīṇām aśvamukhīnām ca niketāḥ tatra tatra tu
translated: And here and there were the abodes of women with horse faces.

original: taṃ deśaṃ samatikramya āśramaṃ siddhasevitam🔽siddhā vaikhānasās tatra vālakhilyāś ca tāpasāḥ
analyzed: tam deśam samatikramya āśramam siddha sevitam  siddhāḥ vaikhānasāḥ tatra vālakhilyāḥ ca tāpasāḥ
translated: Having crossed that region, there was an ashram frequented by the Siddhas.🔽The Siddhas, Vaikhanasas, Valakhilyas and ascetics

original: vandyās te tu tapaḥsiddhās tāpasā vītakalmaṣāḥ
analyzed: vandyāḥ te tu tapaḥ siddhāḥ tāpasāḥ vīta kalmaṣāḥ
translated: were to be worshipped, those ascetics who had perfected austerities and were free from sin.

original: praṣṭavyāś cāpi sītāyāḥ pravṛttaṃ vinayānvitaiḥ🔽hemapuṣkarasaṃchannaṃ tatra vaikhānasaṃ saraḥ
analyzed: praṣṭavyāḥ ca api sītāyāḥ pravṛttam vinaya anvitaiḥ  hema puṣkara saṃchannam tatra vaikhānasam saraḥ
translated: And they should be asked about Sita's whereabouts by those endowed with humility.🔽There was a lake belonging to the Vaikhanasa ascetics, covered with golden lotuses,

original: taruṇādityasaṃkāśair haṃsair vicaritaṃ śubhaiḥ
analyzed: taruṇa āditya saṃkāśaiḥ haṃsaiḥ vicaritam śubhaiḥ
translated: frequented by auspicious swans resembling the rising sun.

original: aupavāhyaḥ kuberasya sarvabhauma iti smṛtaḥ
analyzed: aupavāhyaḥ kuberasya sarvabhaumaḥ iti smṛtaḥ
translated: The elephant named Aupadha, Kubera's mount, known as Sarvabhouma,

original: gajaḥ paryeti taṃ deśaṃ sadā saha kareṇubhiḥ🔽tat sāraḥ samatikramya naṣṭacandradivākaram
analyzed: gajaḥ paryeti tam deśam sadā saha kareṇubhiḥ  tat sāraḥ samatikramya naṣṭa candra divākaram
translated: always roams that region with female elephants.🔽Having crossed that region, where the moon and sun are lost,

original: anakṣatragaṇaṃ vyoma niṣpayodam anāadimat
analyzed: a nakṣatra gaṇam vyoma niṣpayodam an āadimat
translated: the sky devoid of constellations and clouds, without beginning,

original: gabhastibhir ivārkasya sa tu deśaḥ prakāśate
analyzed: gabhastibhiḥ iva arkasya sa tu deśaḥ prakāśate
translated: that region shines as if with the rays of the sun,

original: viśrāmyadbhis tapaḥ siddhair devakalpaiḥ svayamprabhaiḥ
analyzed: viśrāmyadbhiḥ tapaḥ siddhaiḥ deva kalpaiḥ svayamprabhaiḥ
translated: with ascetics who have perfected austerities, resting, divine in appearance, self-luminous.

original: taṃ tu deśam atikramya śailodā nāma nimnagā
analyzed: tam tu deśam atikramya śailodā nāma nimnagā
translated: Beyond that region, there is a river named Shailoda,

original: ubhayos tīrayor yasyāḥ kīcakā nāma veṇavaḥ
analyzed: ubhayoḥ tīrayoḥ yasyāḥ kīcakāḥ nāma veṇavaḥ
translated: on both banks of which are reeds named Kichaka.

original: te nayanti paraṃ tīraṃ siddhān pratyānayanti ca
analyzed: te nayanti param tīram siddhān pratyānayanti ca
translated: They lead the Siddhas to the other shore and bring them back again.

original: uttarāḥ kuravas tatra kṛtapuṇyapratiśriyāḥ
analyzed: uttarāḥ kuravaḥ tatra kṛta puṇya pratiśriyāḥ
translated: The northern Kurus there, with the merit of their good deeds,

original: tataḥ kāñcanapadmābhiḥ padminībhiḥ kṛtodakāḥ
analyzed: tatas kāñcana padmābhiḥ padminībhiḥ kṛta udakāḥ
translated: Then, with golden lotuses, the water is made by the lotuses.

original: nīlavaidūryapatrāḍhyā nadyas tatra sahasraśaḥ
analyzed: nīla vaidūrya patra āḍhyāḥ nadyaḥ tatra sahasraśas
translated: There are thousands of rivers there with leaves of blue lapis lazuli.

original: raktotpalavanaiś cātra maṇḍitāś ca hiraṇmayaiḥ
analyzed: rakta utpala vanaiḥ ca atra maṇḍitāḥ ca hiraṇmayaiḥ
translated: And here they are adorned with forests of red lotuses and with golden ones.

original: taruṇādityasadṛśair bhānti tatra jalāśayāḥ
analyzed: taruṇa āditya sadṛśaiḥ bhānti tatra jalāśayāḥ
translated: The reservoirs of water there shine like the rising sun.

original: mahārhamaṇipatraiś ca kāñcanaprabha kesaraiḥ
analyzed: mahārha maṇi patraiḥ ca kāñcana prabha kesaraiḥ
translated: And with leaves of precious gems and filaments shining like gold,

original: nīlotpalavanaiś citraiḥ sa deśaḥ sarvatovṛtaḥ
analyzed: nīlotpala vanaiḥ citraiḥ sa deśaḥ sarvatas vṛtaḥ
translated: That country is completely surrounded by colorful forests of blue lotuses.

original: nistulābhiś ca muktābhir maṇibhiś ca mahādhanaiḥ
analyzed: nistulābhiḥ ca muktābhiḥ maṇibhiḥ ca mahādhanaiḥ
translated: And with priceless pearls and very valuable jewels,

original: udbhūtapulinās tatra jātarūpaiś ca nimnagāḥ
analyzed: udbhūta pulināḥ tatra jātarūpaiḥ ca nimnagāḥ
translated: The rivers there have banks that are made of gold.

original: sarvaratnamayaiś citrair avagāḍhā nagottamaiḥ
analyzed: sarva ratna mayaiḥ citraiḥ avagāḍhāḥ naga uttamaiḥ
translated: They are filled with the best of mountains, which are colorful and made of all jewels,

original: jātarūpamayaiś cāpi hutāśanasamaprabhaiḥ
analyzed: jātarūpa mayaiḥ ca api hutāśana sama prabhaiḥ
translated: And with others that are made of gold and have the luster of fire.

original: nityapuṣpaphalāś cātra nagāḥ patrarathākulāḥ
analyzed: nitya puṣpa phalāḥ ca atra nagāḥ patraratha ākulāḥ
translated: And here the trees are always full of flowers and fruits, and are filled with birds.

original: divyagandharasasparśāḥ sarvakāmān sravanti ca
analyzed: divya gandha rasa sparśāḥ sarva kāmān sravanti ca
translated: They have divine fragrance, taste, and touch, and exude all desires.

original: nānākārāṇi vāsāṃsi phalanty anye nagottamāḥ
analyzed: nānā ākārāṇi vāsāṃsi phalanti anye naga uttamāḥ
translated: Other best of mountains bear garments of various forms,

original: muktāvaidūryacitrāṇi bhūṣaṇāni tathaiva ca
analyzed: muktā vaidūrya citrāṇi bhūṣaṇāni tathā eva ca
translated: And also ornaments inlaid with pearls and lapis lazuli,

original: strīṇāṃ yāny anurūpāṇi puruṣāṇāṃ tathaiva ca
analyzed: strīṇām yāni anurūpāṇi puruṣāṇām tathā eva ca
translated: Which are suitable for women and likewise for men,

original: sarvartusukhasevyāni phalanty anye nagottamāḥ
analyzed: sarva ṛtu sukha sevyāni phalanti anye naga uttamāḥ
translated: And others bear fruits that are pleasant to use in all seasons.

original: mahārhāṇi vicitrāṇi haimāny anye nagottamāḥ
analyzed: mahārhāṇi vicitrāṇi haimāni anye naga uttamāḥ
translated: Other excellent mountains produce extremely valuable and wonderful golden

original: śayanāni prasūyante citrāstāraṇavanti ca
analyzed: śayanāni prasūyante citra āstāraṇavanti ca
translated: Beds, with colorful spreads and covers.

original: manaḥkāntāni mālyāni phalanty atrāpare drumāḥ
analyzed: manaḥ kāntāni mālyāni phalanti atra apare drumāḥ
translated: Other trees here bear garlands that are pleasing to the mind,

original: pānāni ca mahārhāṇi bhakṣyāṇi vividhāni ca
analyzed: pānāni ca mahārhāṇi bhakṣyāṇi vividhāni ca
translated: And also extremely valuable drinks and various foods,

original: striyaś ca guṇasaṃpannā rūpayauvanalakṣitāḥ
analyzed: striyaḥ ca guṇa saṃpannāḥ rūpa yauvana lakṣitāḥ
translated: And women endowed with good qualities, marked by beauty and youth.

original: gandharvāḥ kiṃnarā siddhā nāgā vidyādharās tathā
analyzed: gandharvāḥ siddhāḥ nāgāḥ vidyādharāḥ tathā
translated: Gandharvas, kinnaras, siddhas, nagas, and vidyadharas,

original: ramante sahitās tatra nārībhir bhāskaraprabhāḥ
analyzed: ramante sahitāḥ tatra nārībhiḥ bhāskara prabhāḥ
translated: Shining like the sun, enjoy themselves there together with women.

original: sarve sukṛtakarmāṇaḥ sarve ratiparāyaṇāḥ
analyzed: sarve su kṛta karmāṇaḥ sarve rati parāyaṇāḥ
translated: All of them are of good deeds, all of them are devoted to pleasure,

original: sarve kāmārthasahitā vasanti saha yoṣitaḥ
analyzed: sarve kāma artha sahitāḥ vasanti saha yoṣitaḥ
translated: All of them are endowed with desire and wealth, and live with women.

original: gītavāditranirghoṣaḥ sotkṛṣṭahasitasvanaḥ
translated: The sound of singing and musical instruments, along with the sound of loud laughter,

original: śrūyate satataṃ tatra sarvabhūtamanoharaḥ
analyzed: śrūyate satatam tatra sarva bhūta manoharaḥ
translated: Is always heard there, captivating the minds of all beings.

original: tatra nāmuditaḥ kaś cin nāsti kaś cid asatpriyaḥ
analyzed: tatra na amuditaḥ kaḥ cit na asti kaḥ cit asat priyaḥ
translated: There is no one who is not delighted, no one who does not love goodness,

original: ahany ahani vardhante guṇās tatra manoramāḥ🔽samatikramya taṃ deśam uttaras toyasāṃ nidhiḥ
analyzed: ahani ahani vardhante guṇāḥ tatra manoramāḥ  samatikramya tam deśam uttaraḥ toyasām nidhiḥ
translated: Day after day, the delightful qualities increase there.🔽Beyond that country lies the northern ocean.

original: tatra somagirir nāma madhye hemamayo mahān
analyzed: tatra somagiriḥ nāma madhye hema mayaḥ mahān
translated: In the middle of that ocean, there is a great golden mountain named Somagiri.

original: indralokagatā ye ca brahmalokagatāś ca ye
analyzed: indra loka gatāḥ ye ca brahma loka gatāḥ ca ye
translated: The gods who have gone to Indra's world and those who have gone to Brahma's world

original: devās taṃ samavekṣante girirājaṃ divaṃ gatam
analyzed: devāḥ tam samavekṣante giri rājam divam gatam
translated: all look at that king of mountains which has gone to heaven.

original: sa tu deśo visūryo 'pi tasya bhāsā prakāśate
analyzed: sa tu deśaḥ visūryaḥ pi tasya bhāsā prakāśate
translated: Even though that country is without the sun, it is illuminated by its radiance.

original: sūryalakṣmyābhivijñeyas tapaseva vivasvatā
analyzed: sūrya lakṣmyā abhivijñeyaḥ tapasā iva vivasvatā
translated: It is known by the glory of the sun, as if by the sun itself for austerity.

original: bhagavān api viśvātmā śambhur ekādaśātmakaḥ
analyzed: bhagavān api viśvātmā śambhuḥ ekādaśa ātmakaḥ
translated: The illustrious one, the soul of the universe, Shambhu, who is of eleven forms,

original: brahmā vasati deveśo brahmarṣiparivāritaḥ
analyzed: brahmā vasati deveśaḥ brahmarṣi parivāritaḥ
translated: resides there, surrounded by the brahmanical sages.

original: na kathaṃ cana gantavyaṃ kurūṇām uttareṇa vaḥ
analyzed: na katham cana gantavyam kurūṇām uttareṇa vaḥ
translated: You should never go north of the Kurus.

original: anyeṣām api bhūtānāṃ nātikrāmati vai gatiḥ
analyzed: anyeṣām api bhūtānām na atikrāmati vai gatiḥ
translated: The speed of other beings cannot surpass that of the wind.

original: sā hi somagirir nāma devānām api durgamaḥ
analyzed: sā hi somagiriḥ nāma devānām api durgamaḥ
translated: That mountain named Somagiri is difficult to access even for the gods.

original: tam ālokya tataḥ kṣipram upāvartitum arhatha
analyzed: tam ālokya tatas kṣipram upāvartitum arhatha
translated: Having seen it, you should quickly return.

original: etāvad vānaraiḥ śakyaṃ gantuṃ vānarapuṃgavāḥ
analyzed: etāvat vānaraiḥ śakyam gantum vānara puṃgavāḥ
translated: O best of monkeys, this much is possible for the monkeys to go.

original: abhāskaram amaryādaṃ na jānīmas tataḥ param
analyzed: abhāskaram amaryādam na jānīmaḥ tatas param
translated: Beyond that, we do not know the sunless and boundless region.

original: sarvam etad vicetavyaṃ yan mayā parikīrtitam
analyzed: sarvam etat vicetavyam yat mayā parikīrtitam
translated: All this that has been described by me should be searched.

original: yad anyad api noktaṃ ca tatrāpi kriyatāṃ matiḥ
analyzed: yat anyat api na uktam ca tatra api kriyatām matiḥ
translated: And let your mind be directed to whatever else has not been mentioned.

original: tataḥ kṛtaṃ dāśarather mahat priyaṃ /
analyzed: tatas kṛtam dāśaratheḥ mahat priyam
translated: Then will be done a great service to Dasharatha's son,

original: mahattaraṃ cāpi tato mama priyam
analyzed: mahattaram ca api tatas mama priyam
translated: and also a very great service to me.

original: kṛtaṃ bhaviṣyaty anilānalopamā /
analyzed: kṛtam bhaviṣyati anila anala upamā
translated: Will be done, O you who are like the wind and the fire,

original: videhajā darśanajena karmaṇā
analyzed: videha jāḥ darśana jena karmaṇā
translated: by the act of seeing the daughter of Videha.

original: tataḥ kṛtārthāḥ sahitāḥ sabāndhavā /
analyzed: tatas kṛtārthāḥ sahitāḥ sa bāndhavā
translated: Then, having accomplished your purpose, united with your kinsmen,

original: mayārcitāḥ sarvaguṇair manoramaiḥ
analyzed: mayā arcitāḥ sarva guṇaiḥ manoramaiḥ
translated: worshipped by me with all agreeable qualities,

original: cariṣyathorvīṃ pratiśāntaśatravaḥ /
analyzed: cariṣyatha urvīm pratiśānta śatravaḥ
translated: you will roam the earth, with your enemies pacified,

original: sahapriyā bhūtadharāḥ plavaṃgamāḥ
analyzed: sahapriyāḥ bhūta dharāḥ plavaṃgamāḥ
translated: together with your beloveds, O monkey-kings.

original: viśeṣeṇa tu sugrīvo hanumatyartham uktavān
analyzed: viśeṣeṇa tu sugrīvaḥ hanumanti artham uktavān
translated: But Sugriva, in particular, spoke for the sake of Hanumat:

original: sa hi tasmin hariśreṣṭhe niścitārtho 'rthasādhane🔽na bhūmau nāntarikṣe vā nāmbare nāmarālaye
analyzed: sa hi tasmin hari śreṣṭhe niścita arthaḥ rtha sādhane  na bhūmau na antarikṣe vā na ambare na amara ālaye
translated: For he was certain that that best of monkeys would accomplish the task.🔽I do not see any impediment to your movement, O bull among monkeys,

original: nāpsu vā gatisaṃgaṃ te paśyāmi haripuṃgava
analyzed: na apsu vā gati saṃgam te paśyāmi hari puṃgava
translated: on earth, in the sky, in the sky, or in the abode of the immortals,🔽or in the waters.

original: sāsurāḥ sahagandharvāḥ sanāganaradevatāḥ
analyzed: sa asurāḥ saha gandharvāḥ sa nāga nara devatāḥ
translated: The Asuras, the Gandharvas, the Nagas, the men and the gods,

original: viditāḥ sarvalokās te sasāgaradharādharāḥ
analyzed: viditāḥ sarva lokāḥ te sa sāgara dharādharāḥ
translated: all the worlds are known to you, with their oceans and mountains.

original: gatir vegaś ca tejaś ca lāghavaṃ ca mahākape
analyzed: gatiḥ vegaḥ ca tejaḥ ca lāghavam ca mahā kape
translated: O great monkey, your speed, your energy, your lightness of movement,

original: pitus te sadṛśaṃ vīra mārutasya mahaujasaḥ
analyzed: pituḥ te sadṛśam vīra mārutasya mahā ojasaḥ
translated: O hero, you are like your father, the wind god of great prowess.

original: tejasā vāpi te bhūtaṃ samaṃ bhuvi na vidyate
analyzed: tejasā vā api te bhūtam samam bhuvi na vidyate
translated: There is no one on earth equal to you in energy.

original: tad yathā labhyate sītā tattvam evopapādaya
analyzed: tat yathā labhyate sītā tattvam eva upapādaya
translated: Therefore, find out the truth about how Sita can be obtained.

original: tvayy eva hanumann asti balaṃ buddhiḥ parākramaḥ
analyzed: tvayi eva hanuman asti balam buddhiḥ parākramaḥ
translated: O Hanumān, you have strength, intelligence and valor.

original: deśakālānuvṛttaś ca nayaś ca nayapaṇḍita🔽tataḥ kāryasamāsaṃgam avagamya hanūmati
analyzed: deśa kāla anuvṛttaḥ ca nayaḥ ca naya paṇḍita  tatas kārya samāsaṃgam avagamya hanumati
translated: O wise one in policy, your policy accords with place and time.🔽Then, having understood the summary of the task in Hanumān,

original: viditvā hanumantaṃ ca cintayām āsa rāghavaḥ
analyzed: viditvā hanumantam ca cintayām āsa rāghavaḥ
translated: and having known about Hanumān, Rāghava thought.

original: sarvathā niścitārtho 'yaṃ hanūmati harīśvaraḥ
analyzed: sarvathā niścita arthaḥ yam hanūmati hari īśvaraḥ
translated: The lord of monkeys is completely certain about Hanumān.

original: niścitārthataraś cāpi hanūmān kāryasādhane
analyzed: niścitārthataraḥ ca api hanūmān kārya sādhane
translated: And Hanumān is even more certain about accomplishing the task.

original: tad evaṃ prasthitasyāsya parijñātasya karmabhiḥ
analyzed: tat evam prasthitasya asya parijñātasya karmabhiḥ
translated: Thus, for him who has set out like this, whose identity is known by his deeds,

original: bhartrā parigṛhītasya dhruvaḥ kāryaphalodayaḥ
analyzed: bhartrā parigṛhītasya dhruvaḥ kārya phala udayaḥ
translated: and who has been accepted by his master, the rise of the fruit of the task is certain.

original: taṃ samīkṣya mahātejā vyavasāyottaraṃ harim
analyzed: tam samīkṣya mahā tejāḥ vyavasāya uttaram harim
translated: Seeing that monkey of great prowess who was superior in resolve,

original: kṛtārtha iva saṃvṛttaḥ prahṛṣṭendriyamānasaḥ🔽dadau tasya tataḥ prītaḥ svanāmāṅkopaśobhitam
analyzed: kṛtārthaḥ iva saṃvṛttaḥ prahṛṣṭa indriya mānasaḥ  dadau tasya tatas prītaḥ sva nāma aṅka upaśobhitam
translated: he became as if successful, with delighted senses and mind.🔽Then, being pleased, the scorcher of enemies gave him a ring adorned with his own name,

original: aṅgulīyam abhijñānaṃ rājaputryāḥ paraṃtapaḥ
analyzed: aṅgulīyam abhijñānam rāja putryāḥ paraṃtapaḥ
translated: a token of recognition from the princess.

original: anena tvāṃ hariśreṣṭha cihnena janakātmajā
analyzed: anena tvām hari śreṣṭha cihnena janakātmajā
translated: O best of monkeys, the daughter of Janaka

original: matsakāśād anuprāptam anudvignānupaśyati
analyzed: mad sakāśāt anuprāptam an udvignā anupaśyati
translated: will see you, who have come from me, without any anxiety, by this token.

original: vyavasāyaś ca te vīra sattvayuktaś ca vikramaḥ
analyzed: vyavasāyaḥ ca te vīra sattva yuktaḥ ca vikramaḥ
translated: And, O hero, your resolution and your strength of character and prowess

original: sugrīvasya ca saṃdeśaḥ siddhiṃ kathayatīva me🔽sa tad gṛhya hariśreṣṭhaḥ sthāpya mūrdhni kṛtāñjaliḥ
analyzed: sugrīvasya ca saṃdeśaḥ siddhim kathayati iva me  sa tat gṛhya hari śreṣṭhaḥ sthāpya mūrdhni kṛtāñjaliḥ
translated: and Sugriva's message seem to indicate success to me.🔽The best of monkeys, having accepted it, placed it on his head with folded hands,

original: vanditvā caraṇau caiva prasthitaḥ plavagottamaḥ🔽sa tat prakarṣan hariṇāṃ balaṃ mahad /
analyzed: vanditvā caraṇau ca eva prasthitaḥ plavaga uttamaḥ  sa tat prakarṣan hariṇām balam mahat
translated: and having saluted his feet, the best of the monkeys set out.

original: babhūva vīraḥ pavanātmajaḥ kapi🔽gatāmbude vyomni viśuddhamaṇḍalaḥ /
analyzed: babhūva vīraḥ pavana ātmajaḥ kapi
translated: The heroic monkey, the son of the wind-god, leading that great army of monkeys,🔽appeared like the moon with a clear orb in the sky free from clouds,

original: śaśīva nakṣatragaṇopaśobhitaḥ🔽atibalabalam āśritas tavāhaṃ /
analyzed: śaśī iva nakṣatra gaṇa upaśobhitaḥ  ati bala balam āśritaḥ tava aham
translated: adorned with a multitude of stars,🔽O Hanumān, I am supported by your immense strength,

original: harivaravikramavikramair analpaiḥ🔽pavanasuta yathābhigamyate sā /
analyzed: hari vara vikrama vikramaiḥ analpaiḥ  pavanasuta yathā abhigamyate sā
translated: by your many heroic strides, O best of monkeys,

original: janakasutā hanumaṃs tathā kuruṣva🔽tad ugraśāsanaṃ bhartur vijñāya haripuṃgavāḥ
analyzed: janakasutāḥ hanuman tathā kuruṣva  tat ugra śāsanam bhartuḥ vijñāya hari puṃgavāḥ
translated: O son of the wind-god, act in such a way that the daughter of Janaka is reached by me.🔽Having understood the severe command of their master, the bulls among monkeys,

original: śalabhā iva saṃchādya medinīṃ saṃpratasthire
analyzed: śalabhāḥ iva saṃchādya medinīm saṃpratasthire
translated: set out covering the earth like locusts.

original: rāmaḥ prasravaṇe tasmin nyavasat sahalakṣmaṇaḥ
analyzed: rāmaḥ prasravaṇe tasmin nyavasat sahalakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Rama stayed at that waterfall with Lakshmana,

original: pratīkṣamāṇas taṃ māsaṃ yaḥ sītādhigame kṛtaḥ
analyzed: pratīkṣamāṇaḥ tam māsam yaḥ sītā adhigame kṛtaḥ
translated: Waiting for that month, which was fixed for the discovery of Sita,

original: uttarāṃ tu diśaṃ ramyāṃ girirājasamāvṛtām
analyzed: uttarām tu diśam ramyām giri rāja samāvṛtām
translated: The beautiful northern direction, surrounded by the king of mountains,

original: pratasthe sahasā vīro hariḥ śatabalis tadā
analyzed: pratasthe sahasā vīraḥ hariḥ śatabaliḥ tadā
translated: The hero Hari, Shatabali, suddenly set out then.

original: pūrvāṃ diśaṃ prati yayau vinato hariyūthapaḥ
analyzed: pūrvām diśam prati yayau vinataḥ hari yūthapaḥ
translated: Vinata, the leader of the monkey troop, went towards the eastern direction.

original: tārāṅgadādi sahitaḥ plavagaḥ pavanātmajaḥ
analyzed: tārā aṅgada ādi sahitaḥ plavagaḥ pavanātmajaḥ
translated: The monkey, the son of the wind god, accompanied by Tara, Angada and others,

original: agastyacaritām āśāṃ dakṣiṇāṃ hariyūthapaḥ
analyzed: agastya caritām āśām dakṣiṇām hari yūthapaḥ
translated: The leader of the monkey troop, in the southern direction frequented by Agastya,

original: paścimāṃ tu diśaṃ ghorāṃ suṣeṇaḥ plavageśvaraḥ
analyzed: paścimām tu diśam ghorām suṣeṇaḥ plavaga īśvaraḥ
translated: Sushena, the lord of the monkeys, towards the terrible western direction,

original: pratasthe hariśārdūlo bhṛśaṃ varuṇapālitām
analyzed: pratasthe hari śārdūlaḥ bhṛśam varuṇa pālitām
translated: The tiger among monkeys, greatly protected by Varuna, set out.

original: tataḥ sarvā diśo rājā codayitvā yathā tatham
analyzed: tatas sarvāḥ diśaḥ rājā codayitvā yathā tatham
translated: Then, having thus ordered all the directions,

original: kapisenā patīn mukhyān mumoda sukhitaḥ sukham
analyzed: kapisenā patīn mukhyān mumoda sukhitaḥ sukham
translated: The king, delighted, rejoiced happily with the foremost leaders of the monkey army.

original: evaṃ saṃcoditāḥ sarve rājñā vānarayūthapāḥ
analyzed: evam saṃcoditāḥ sarve rājñā vānara yūthapāḥ
translated: Thus, all the leaders of the monkey troops, ordered by the king,

original: svāṃ svāṃ diśam abhipretya tvaritāḥ saṃpratasthire
analyzed: svām svām diśam abhipretya tvaritāḥ saṃpratasthire
translated: Swiftly set out, each towards their own direction.

original: nadantaś connadantaś ca garjantaś ca plavaṃgamāḥ🔽kṣvelanto dhāvamānāś ca yayuḥ plavagasattamāḥ
analyzed: nadantaḥ ca unnadantaḥ ca garjantaḥ ca plavaṃgamāḥ  kṣvelantaḥ dhāvamānāḥ ca yayuḥ plavaga sattamāḥ
translated: The monkeys roared, shouted, thundered,

original: ānayiṣyāmahe sītāṃ haniṣyāmaś ca rāvaṇam
analyzed: ānayiṣyāmahe sītām haniṣyāmaḥ ca rāvaṇam
translated: The best of the monkeys ran and went, saying, We will bring back Sita and kill Ravana.

original: aham eko haniṣyāmi prāptaṃ rāvaṇam āhave
analyzed: aham ekaḥ haniṣyāmi prāptam rāvaṇam āhave
translated: I alone will kill Ravana when he comes to the battle.

original: tataś conmathya sahasā hariṣye janakātmajām
analyzed: tatas ca unmathya sahasā hariṣye janakātmajām
translated: And then, having suddenly attacked, I will carry off Janaka's daughter.

original: vepamānaṃ śrameṇādya bhavadbhiḥ sthīyatām iti
analyzed: vepamānam śrameṇa adya bhavadbhiḥ sthīyatām iti
translated: Today, trembling with fatigue, you all should stay here.

original: eka evāhariṣyāmi pātālād api jānakīm
analyzed: ekaḥ evā āhariṣyāmi pātālāt api jānakīm
translated: I alone will bring back Janakee even from the netherworld.

original: vidhamiṣyāmy ahaṃ vṛkṣān dārayiṣyāmy ahaṃ girīn
analyzed: vidhamiṣyāmi aham vṛkṣān dārayiṣyāmi aham girīn
translated: I will break down trees, I will shatter mountains,

original: dharaṇīṃ dārayiṣyāmi kṣobhayiṣyāmi sāgarān🔽ahaṃ yojanasaṃkhyāyāḥ plavitā nātra saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: dharaṇīm dārayiṣyāmi kṣobhayiṣyāmi sāgarān  aham yojana saṃkhyāyāḥ plavitā na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: I will cleave the earth, I will agitate the oceans.🔽I will swim a hundred yojanas, there is no doubt about it.

original: śataṃ yojanasaṃkhyāyāḥ śataṃ samadhikaṃ hy aham
analyzed: śatam yojana saṃkhyāyāḥ śatam samadhikam hi aham
translated: I can swim a hundred yojanas, or even more than that.

original: bhūtale sāgare vāpi śaileṣu ca vaneṣu ca
analyzed: bhū tale sāgare vā api śaileṣu ca vaneṣu ca
translated: On the earth, in the ocean, in mountains and forests,

original: pātālasyāpi vā madhye na mamācchidyate gatiḥ
analyzed: pātālasya api vā madhye na mama ācchidyate gatiḥ
translated: or even in the middle of the netherworld, my progress is unimpeded.

original: ity ekaikaṃ tadā tatra vānarā baladarpitāḥ
analyzed: iti ekaikam tadā tatra vānarāḥ bala darpitāḥ
translated: Thus, each one there, the monkeys proud of their strength,

original: ūcuś ca vacanaṃ tasmin harirājasya saṃnidhau
analyzed: ūcuḥ ca vacanam tasmin hari rājasya saṃnidhau
translated: spoke these words in the presence of the king of the monkeys.

original: gateṣu vānarendreṣu rāmaḥ sugrīvam abravīt
analyzed: gateṣu vānara indreṣu rāmaḥ sugrīvam abravīt
translated: When the monkey kings had arrived, Rama said to Sugriva:

original: kathaṃ bhavān vinājīte sarvaṃ vai maṇḍalaṃ bhuvaḥ
analyzed: katham bhavān vinā ājīte sarvam vai maṇḍalam bhuvaḥ
translated: How did you conquer the entire circle of the earth?

original: sugrīvas tu tato rāmam uvāca praṇatātmavān
analyzed: sugrīvaḥ tu tatas rāmam uvāca praṇata ātmavān
translated: Then Sugriva, with a humble mind, said to Rama:

original: śrūyatāṃ sarvam ākhyāsye vistareṇa nararṣabha
analyzed: śrūyatām sarvam ākhyāsye vistareṇa nara ṛṣabha
translated: Listen, O best of men, I shall tell you everything in detail.

original: yadā tu dundubhiṃ nāma dānavaṃ mahiṣākṛtim🔽parikālayate vālī malayaṃ prati parvatam🔽tadā viveśa mahiṣo malayasya guhāṃ prati
analyzed: yadā tu dundubhim nāma dānavam mahiṣa ākṛtim  parikālayate vālī malayam prati parvatam  tadā viveśa mahiṣaḥ malayasya guhām prati
translated: When Vali was pursuing a demon named Dundubhi, in the form of a buffalo,🔽towards the Malaya mountain,🔽then the buffalo entered a cave in the Malaya mountain.

original: viveśa vālī tatrāpi malayaṃ tajjighāṃsayā
analyzed: viveśa vālī tatra api malayam tad jighāṃsayā
translated: Vali also entered the Malaya mountain, with the intention of killing him.

original: tato 'haṃ tatra nikṣipto guhād vārivinītavat
analyzed: tatas ham tatra nikṣiptaḥ guhāt vāri vinīta vat
translated: Then I was placed there, like water poured out of a cave.

original: na ca niṣkramate vālī tadā saṃvatsare gate
analyzed: na ca niṣkramate vālī tadā saṃvatsare gate
translated: And Vali did not come out even after a year had passed.

original: tataḥ kṣatajavegena āpupūre tadā bilam
analyzed: tatas kṣataja vegena āpupūre tadā bilam
translated: Then the cave was filled with the flow of blood.

original: tad ahaṃ vismito dṛṣṭvā bhrātṛśokaviṣārditaḥ
analyzed: tat aham vismitaḥ dṛṣṭvā bhrātṛ śoka viṣa arditaḥ
translated: Seeing that, I was amazed, afflicted by the poison of grief for my brother.

original: athāhaṃ kṛtabuddhis tu suvyaktaṃ nihato guruḥ
analyzed: atha aham kṛtabuddhiḥ tu su vyaktam nihataḥ guruḥ
translated: Then I made up my mind that the guru was certainly killed.

analyzed: tatas ham āgām kiṣkindhām nirāśaḥ tasya jīvite

original: parilākayate krodhād dhāvantaṃ sacivaiḥ saha
analyzed: parilākayate krodhāt dhāvantam sacivaiḥ saha

original: tato 'haṃ vālinā tena sānubandhaḥ pradhāvitaḥ
analyzed: tatas ham vālinā tena sānubandhaḥ pradhāvitaḥ

original: nadīś ca vividhāḥ paśyan vanāni nagarāṇi ca
analyzed: nadīḥ ca vividhāḥ paśyan vanāni nagarāṇi ca
translated: Seeing various rivers, forests and cities,

analyzed: ādarśa tala saṃkāśā tatas vai pṛthivī mayā

analyzed: alāta cakra pratimā dṛṣṭā goṣpada vat tadā

analyzed: tatas pūrvam aham gatvā dakṣiṇām aham āśritaḥ

analyzed: diśam ca paścimām bhūyas gataḥ smi bhaya śaṅkitaḥ

analyzed: uttarām tu diśam yāntam hanumān mām atha abravīt
translated: Then Hanumān said to me, as I was going to the north,

analyzed: idānīm me smṛtam rājan yathā vālī hari īśvaraḥ
translated: Now, O king, I remember how Vāli, the lord of monkeys,

analyzed: mataṅgena tadā śaptaḥ hi asmin āśrama maṇḍale
translated: was cursed by Matanga in this group of hermitages:

analyzed: praviśet yadi vā vālī mūrdhā asya śatadhā bhavet

original: tataḥ parvatam āsādya ṛśyamūkaṃ nṛpātmaja
analyzed: tatas parvatam āsādya ṛśyamūkam nṛpa ātmaja
translated: Then, O prince, having reached the mountain Rishyamuka,

analyzed: na viveśa tadā vālī mataṅgasya bhayāt tadā

analyzed: nadī durgān tathā śailān vicinvanti samantataḥ

analyzed: samāyānti sma medinyām vānarāḥ

analyzed: nimnagāḥ sāgara antāḥ ca sarve janapadāḥ tathā
translated: The rivers, oceans, and all the countries have been searched.

analyzed: guhāḥ ca vicitāḥ sarvāḥ yāḥ tvayā parikīrtitāḥ

analyzed: gahaneṣu ca deśeṣu durgeṣu viṣameṣu ca
translated: And in the dense regions, inaccessible and uneven,

analyzed: saha tārā aṅgadābhyām tu gatvā sa hanumān kapiḥ

original: tasya tasmin vane putro bālako daśavārṣikaḥ
analyzed: tasya tasmin vane putraḥ bālakaḥ daśa vārṣikaḥ
translated: In that forest, his son, a boy of ten years,

analyzed: pranaṣṭaḥ jīvita antāya kruddhaḥ tatra mahā muniḥ

translated: But when he stopped breathing, the monkeys, desiring victory,

analyzed: vanāni girayaḥ nadyaḥ durgāṇi gahanāni ca
